title: Exodus 17:3
content: 3 And the people were thirsty for water there, and the people murmured against Moses. And he said, “Is this why you brought us up from Egypt? To kill me and my sons and my cattle, with thirst?”

title: Exodus 17:4
content: 4 And Moses cried out to Yahweh, saying, “What should I do for this people? A little longer and they will stone me.”

title: Exodus 17:5
content: 5 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Pass before the face of the people, and take with you some of the elders of Israel, and your staff, the one with which you struck the river, take in your hand; and go.

title: Exodus 17:6
content: 6 Behold me! I will stand before your face there on the rock at Horeb. And you will strike on the rock, and water will come from it, and the people will drink.” And Moses did so in the eyes of the elders of Israel.

title: Exodus 17:7
content: 7 And he called the name of the place Massah and Meribah, for the conflict of the sons of Israel and for their testing of Yahweh by saying, “Is Yahweh among us or not?”

title: Exodus 17:8
content: 8 And Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.

title: Exodus 17:9
content: 9 And Moses said to Joshua, “Choose men for us and go out. Fight with Amalek. Tomorrow I will be stationed on top of the hill, and the staff of God will be in my hand.”

title: Exodus 17:10
content: 10 And Joshua did as Moses said to him, to fight Amalek. And Moses, Aaron, and Hur climbed up to the top of the hill.

title: Exodus 17:11
content: 11 And so it was, when Moses raised his hand, then Israel would be winning, and when he set his hand down, then Amalek would be winning.

title: Exodus 17:12
content: 12 And the hands of Moses became heavy. And they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat on it, and Aaron and Hur held his hands up, one from this, and one from that. And so his hands were steady until the sun went down.

title: Exodus 17:13
content: 13 And Joshua defeated Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.

title: Exodus 17:14
content: 14 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Write this memory in the book and put it in the ears of Joshua, because I will certainly blot out the memory of Amalek from under the skies.”

title: Exodus 17:15
content: 15 And Moses built an altar, and he called its name “Yahweh is my banner.”

title: Exodus 17:16
content: 16 And he said, “Because a hand was against the throne of Yah, war is to Yahweh against Amalek from generation to generation.”

title: Exodus 18:1
content: 1 And Jethro, the priest of Midian, father-in-law of Moses, heard all that God had done for Moses and for Israel his people; that Yahweh brought Israel out from Egypt.

title: Exodus 18:2
content: 2 And Jethro, father-in-law of Moses, took Zipporah, wife of Moses, after he had sent her back,

title: Exodus 18:3
content: 3 and her two sons; one of whose names was Gershom, for he had said, “I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.”

title: Exodus 18:4
content: 4 And the name of the other was Eliezer, for “The God of my father was my helper. And he rescued me from the sword of Pharaoh.”

title: Exodus 18:5
content: 5 And Jethro, the father-in-law of Moses, came, and his sons and his wife, to Moses, to the wilderness where he was camping, at the mountain of God.

title: Exodus 18:6
content: 6 And he said to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you, and your wife, and her two sons with her.”

title: Exodus 18:7
content: 7 And Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and he bowed down and kissed him. And they asked, each man his friend, of their welfare, and they went into the tent.

title: Exodus 18:8
content: 8 And Moses related to his father-in-law all that Yahweh had done to Pharaoh and to Egypt on account of Israel, all the hardship that found them along the way, and of Yahweh rescuing them.

title: Exodus 18:9
content: 9 And Jethro rejoiced over all the good that Yahweh had done for Israel, whom he rescued from the hand of Egypt.

title: Exodus 18:10
content: 10 And Jethro said, “Bless Yahweh, who rescued you out of the hand of Egypt and out of the hand of Pharaoh, who rescued the people from under the hand of Egypt.

title: Exodus 18:11
content: 11 Now I know that Yahweh is greater than all the gods, because of the affair {in} which they acted proudly against them.”

title: Exodus 18:12
content: 12 And Jethro, the father-in-law of Moses, took a burnt offering and sacrifices to God. And Aaron came, and all of the elders of Israel, to eat bread before the face of God with the father-in-law of Moses.

title: Exodus 18:13
content: 13 And so it happened the next day that Moses sat down to judge the people. And the people stood around Moses from morning until evening.

title: Exodus 18:14
content: 14 And the father-in-law of Moses was watching all that he did for the people, and he said, “What is this thing that you are doing with the people? For what purpose do you sit alone, and all the people position themselves next to you from morning until evening?”

title: Exodus 18:15
content: 15 And Moses said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to inquire of God.

title: Exodus 18:16
content: 16 When a situation comes up among them, someone comes to me. And I judge between a man and his associate, and I help them understand the statutes of God and his laws.”

title: Exodus 18:17
content: 17 And the father-in-law of Moses said to him, “The thing which you are doing is not good.

title: Exodus 18:18
content: 18 You will certainly wear yourself out, both you and also these people who are with you, because the thing is too heavy for you. You are not able to do it alone.

title: Exodus 18:19
content: 19 Now, listen to my voice. I will advise you, and God will be with you. You be before God for the people, and you should bring their disputes to God yourself.

title: Exodus 18:20
content: 20 And you should teach them the statutes and the laws. And you should cause them to know the way they should walk in and the work that they should do.

title: Exodus 18:21
content: 21 And you yourself should search out from all of the people men of ability, fearers of God, men of faithfulness, haters of dishonest profit. And you should appoint over them: leaders of thousands, leaders of hundreds, leaders of fifties, and leaders of tens.

title: Exodus 18:22
content: 22 And they will judge the people at all times. And so it will be, every great situation they will bring to you, and every small situation they will judge themselves. And you must lighten {this thing} from on you! And they will carry alongside you.

title: Exodus 18:23
content: 23 If you do this thing, and God instructs you, then you will be able to endure, and furthermore, all of this people will go to its place in peace.”

title: Exodus 18:24
content: 24 And Moses listened to the voice of his father-in-law and did everything that he had said.

title: Exodus 18:25
content: 25 And Moses chose men of ability from all Israel, and he appointed them heads over the people, leaders of thousands, leaders of hundreds, leaders of fifties, and leaders of tens.

title: Exodus 18:26
content: 26 And they judged the people at all times. They brought the difficult situations to Moses, and they judged each small situation themselves.

title: Exodus 18:27
content: 27 And Moses let his father-in-law go, and he went into his own land.

title: Exodus 19:1
content: 1 In the third month from the people of Israel exiting the land of Egypt, on the same day, they entered the wilderness of Sinai.

title: Exodus 19:2
content: 2 And they departed from Rephidim, and they entered the wilderness of Sinai, and they camped in the wilderness. And Israel camped there in front of the mountain.

title: Exodus 19:3
content: 3 And Moses went up to God, and Yahweh called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus you shall speak to the house of Jacob, and you shall tell the sons of Israel:

title: Exodus 19:4
content: 4 ‘You yourselves saw what I did to the Egyptians, how I carried you on the wings of eagles and brought you to myself.

title: Exodus 19:5
content: 5 And now, if you listen intently to my voice and keep my covenant, then you will be my possession from among all peoples. For all the earth is mine,

title: Exodus 19:6
content: 6 and you yourselves will be my kingdom of priests and holy nation.’ These are the words that you shall speak to the sons of Israel.”

title: Exodus 19:7
content: 7 And Moses came and summoned the elders of the people. And he set before their faces all these words that Yahweh had commanded him.

title: Exodus 19:8
content: 8 And all the people responded together, and they said, “We will do everything that Yahweh has said.” And Moses brought the words of the people back to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 19:9
content: 9 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Look, I will come to you in a thick cloud so that the people may hear when I speak with you and may also trust in you forever.” And Moses told the words of the people to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 19:10
content: 10 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Go to the people and make them holy today and tomorrow, and have them wash their clothing,

title: Exodus 19:11
content: 11 and they will be prepared for the third day; for on the third day Yahweh will come down to Mount Sinai before the eyes of all the people.

title: Exodus 19:12
content: 12 And you shall set boundaries for the people all around, saying, ‘Watch yourselves climbing on the mountain or touching on its edge. Every mountain toucher shall certainly be killed.

title: Exodus 19:13
content: 13 No hand shall touch that one. Instead, he shall be stoned or he shall be shot. Whether animal or human, he shall not live.’ At the prolonged sound of the horn, they shall ascend on the mountain.”

title: Exodus 19:14
content: 14 And Moses went down from the mountain to the people. And he made the people holy, and they washed their clothing.

title: Exodus 19:15
content: 15 And he said to the people, “Be prepared by the third day; you shall not come near to a woman.”

title: Exodus 19:16
content: 16 And it happened on the third day, when it was the morning, there were thunder and lightning and a heavy cloud on the mountain, and an extremely strong horn sound. And all the people who were in the camp were trembling.

title: Exodus 19:17
content: 17 And Moses brought the people out from the camp to meet God, and they stationed themselves at the bottom of the mountain.

title: Exodus 19:18
content: 18 And Mount Sinai smoked—all of it—because Yahweh descended on it in fire. And its smoke went up like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain trembled mightily.

title: Exodus 19:19
content: 19 And it happened, the sound of the horn went very strong. Moses was speaking, and God was answering him in a voice.

title: Exodus 19:20
content: 20 And Yahweh descended on Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain, and Yahweh called Moses to the top of the mountain. And Moses ascended.

title: Exodus 19:21
content: 21 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Go down and warn the people lest they break through to Yahweh to see and many from them fall.

title: Exodus 19:22
content: 22 And furthermore, the priests, the ones who come near to Yahweh, they shall make themselves holy lest Yahweh bursts out against them.”

title: Exodus 19:23
content: 23 And Moses said to Yahweh, “The people are not able to come up on Mount Sinai, for you yourself warned us, saying: ‘Set boundaries on the mountain and set it apart.’”

title: Exodus 19:24
content: 24 And Yahweh said to him, “Go, climb down. And you shall come back up, you and Aaron with you; and the priests and the people shall not break through to come up to Yahweh, lest he burst out against them.”

title: Exodus 19:25
content: 25 And Moses went down to the people, and he spoke to them.

title: Exodus 20:1
content: 1 God spoke all these words, saying:

title: Exodus 20:2
content: 2 “I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out from the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery.

title: Exodus 20:3
content: 3 There shall not be to you other gods above my face.

title: Exodus 20:4
content: 4 You shall not make for yourself a carved figure or the likeness of anything that is in heaven above or that is in the earth beneath or that is in the water under the earth.

title: Exodus 20:5
content: 5 You shall not bow down to them and you shall not serve them, for I, Yahweh your God, am a jealous God. I visit the iniquity of the fathers on the sons on the third and on the fourth of the haters of me.

title: Exodus 20:6
content: 6 But I show covenant faithfulness to thousands, to lovers of me and to keepers of my commandments.

title: Exodus 20:7
content: 7 You shall not lift up the name of Yahweh your God with emptiness, for Yahweh will not leave unpunished anyone who lifts up my name with emptiness.

title: Exodus 20:8
content: 8 Remember the Sabbath day, to set it apart to me.

title: Exodus 20:9
content: 9 Six days you may labor and do all your work,

title: Exodus 20:10
content: 10 but the seventh day is a Sabbath for Yahweh your God. You shall not do any work, you or your son or your daughter, your male servant or your female servant or your cattle or the foreigner who is within your gates.

title: Exodus 20:11
content: 11 For in six days Yahweh made the heavens and earth, the sea, and everything that is in them, and rested on the seventh day. Therefore Yahweh blessed the Sabbath day and set it apart.

title: Exodus 20:12
content: 12 Honor your father and your mother, so that your days may be long on the land that Yahweh your God is giving you.

title: Exodus 20:13
content: 13 You shall not murder.

title: Exodus 20:14
content: 14 You shall not commit adultery.

title: Exodus 20:15
content: 15 You shall not steal.

title: Exodus 20:16
content: 16 You shall not testify false testimony against your neighbor.

title: Exodus 20:17
content: 17 You shall not covet the house of your neighbor; you shall not covet the wife of your neighbor or his male servant or his female servant or his ox or his donkey or anything that belongs to your neighbor.”

title: Exodus 20:18
content: 18 All the people were seeing the thundering and the lightning and the sound of the horn and the mountain smoking. And the people saw it, and they trembled, and they stood from a distance.

title: Exodus 20:19
content: 19 They said to Moses, “You speak to us and let us listen! But do not let God speak to us, lest we die.”

title: Exodus 20:20
content: 20 And Moses said to the people, “Do not be afraid, for God has come to test you so that the fear of him may be above your faces and so that you do not sin.”

title: Exodus 20:21
content: 21 So the people stood far off, and Moses approached toward the thick darkness where God was.

title: Exodus 20:22
content: 22 And Yahweh said to Moses, “You shall speak thus to the sons of Israel: ‘You yourselves have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.

title: Exodus 20:23
content: 23 You shall not make alongside me—you shall not make gods of silver or gods of gold for yourselves.

title: Exodus 20:24
content: 24 You shall make an altar of earth for me, and you shall sacrifice on it your burnt offerings, and peace offerings, sheep, and oxen. In every place where I cause my name to be remembered, I will come to you and bless you.

title: Exodus 20:25
content: 25 And if you make me an altar of stones, you shall not build them of cut stones, for causing your tool to move over it will defile it.

title: Exodus 20:26
content: 26 And you shall not go up to my altar on steps, so that your nakedness is not exposed over it.’

title: Exodus 21:1
content: 1 And these are the ordinances that you shall set before their faces:

title: Exodus 21:2
content: 2 ‘If you buy a Hebrew servant, he shall serve for six years, and in the seventh year he shall go free without paying anything.

title: Exodus 21:3
content: 3 If he came by himself, he shall go free by himself; if he is the husband of a wife, then his wife shall go free with him.

title: Exodus 21:4
content: 4 If his master gave him a wife and she bore him sons or daughters, the wife and her children are her master’s, and he must go out by himself.

title: Exodus 21:5
content: 5 But if the servant plainly says, “I love my master, my wife, and my children; I shall not go out free,”

title: Exodus 21:6
content: 6 then his master shall bring him to God. He shall bring him to a door or to a doorpost, and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl. Then he shall serve him forever.

title: Exodus 21:7
content: 7 And if a man sells his daughter as a female servant, she shall not go out as the male servants go out.

title: Exodus 21:8
content: 8 If she is bad in the eyes of her master, who has appointed her for himself, then he shall cause her to be ransomed. He has no authority to sell her to a foreign people, since he has acted treacherously with her.

title: Exodus 21:9
content: 9 And if he appoints her for his son, he shall act toward her according to the custom of daughters.

title: Exodus 21:10
content: 10 If he takes another to himself, he shall not diminish her food, her clothing, or her marital rights.

title: Exodus 21:11
content: 11 But if he does not provide these three things to her, then she can go free without silver.

title: Exodus 21:12
content: 12 Whoever strikes a man and he dies, he shall surely be put to death.

title: Exodus 21:13
content: 13 But if he did not lie in wait, but God let it happen by his hand, then I will appoint a place for you where he can flee.

title: Exodus 21:14
content: 14 If a man willfully acts against his neighbor to kill him with cunning, then you shall take him from my altar for execution.

title: Exodus 21:15
content: 15 Whoever hits his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.

title: Exodus 21:16
content: 16 Whoever steals a man—whether he sells him, or he is found in his hand—he shall surely be put to death.

title: Exodus 21:17
content: 17 Whoever acts contemptuously toward his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.

title: Exodus 21:18
content: 18 If men fight and a man hits his neighbor with a stone or with his fist, and he does not die but falls to bed,

title: Exodus 21:19
content: 19 if he rises and walks about in the outdoors on his staff, then the striker is free. He only shall pay for his sitting and for his complete healing.

title: Exodus 21:20
content: 20 And if a man hits his male servant or his female servant with a staff and he dies under his hand, he shall certainly be avenged.

title: Exodus 21:21
content: 21 However, if he stands a day or two, he shall not be avenged, for he is his silver.

title: Exodus 21:22
content: 22 And if men fight together and strike a pregnant woman and her children come out, but there is no serious injury, then he shall surely be fined as the husband of the woman puts on him, and he shall give according to the judges.

title: Exodus 21:23
content: 23 But if there is serious injury, then you shall give a life for a life,

title: Exodus 21:24
content: 24 an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, a hand for a hand, a foot for a foot,

title: Exodus 21:25
content: 25 a burn for a burn, a wound for a wound, or a bruise for a bruise.

title: Exodus 21:26
content: 26 And if a man hits the eye of his male servant or the eye of his female servant and destroys it, he shall let him go free in compensation for his eye.

title: Exodus 21:27
content: 27 And if he knocks out a tooth of his male servant or a tooth of his female servant, he shall let him go free as compensation for the tooth.

title: Exodus 21:28
content: 28 And if an ox gores a man or a woman and he dies, the ox shall surely be stoned, and its flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the ox is innocent.

title: Exodus 21:29
content: 29 But if the ox had a habit of goring in the past, and its owner was warned but did not keep it in, and it kills a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned and its owner also shall be put to death.

title: Exodus 21:30
content: 30 If a ransom is imposed on him, he shall give the ransom of his life, according to all that is imposed on him.

title: Exodus 21:31
content: 31 If it gores a son or it gores a daughter, it shall be done to him according to this ordinance.

title: Exodus 21:32
content: 32 If the ox gores a male servant or a female servant, he shall give thirty silver shekels to the master, and the ox shall be stoned.

title: Exodus 21:33
content: 33 And if a man opens a cistern or if a man digs a cistern and does not cover it and an ox or a donkey falls there,

title: Exodus 21:34
content: 34 the owner of the pit shall compensate. He shall cause silver to return to its owner, and the dead animal shall become his.

title: Exodus 21:35
content: 35 And if the ox of a man strikes the ox of another and it dies, then they shall sell the live ox and divide its silver, and they shall also divide the dead {ox}.

title: Exodus 21:36
content: 36 If it was known that the ox had a habit of goring in the past, and its owner has not kept it in, he shall surely compensate ox for ox, and the dead animal shall become his own.

title: Exodus 22:1
content: 1 If a man steals an ox or a sheep and slaughters it or sells it, he shall compensate five cattle for the ox, and four sheep for the sheep.

title: Exodus 22:2
content: 2 If a thief is found while breaking in, and he is struck and he dies, there is no bloodguilt for him.

title: Exodus 22:3
content: 3 But if the sun has risen on him, there is bloodguilt for him. He shall surely make restitution. If he has nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.

title: Exodus 22:4
content: 4 If the stolen thing is actually found alive in his hand, from an ox to a donkey to a sheep, he shall compensate double.

title: Exodus 22:5
content: 5 If a man causes his livestock to graze a field or vineyard and lets it go, and it grazes in the field of another, he shall compensate from the best of his field and from the best of his vineyard.

title: Exodus 22:6
content: 6 If a fire breaks out and spreads in thorns and stacked grain or the standing grain or a field is consumed, the fire starter shall surely compensate.

title: Exodus 22:7
content: 7 If a man gives silver or goods to his neighbor for safekeeping, and if it is stolen from the house of the man, if the thief is found, he shall compensate double.

title: Exodus 22:8
content: 8 If the thief is not found, then the owner of the house shall be brought to God, whether or not he has stretched out his hand against the property of his neighbor.

title: Exodus 22:9
content: 9 Concerning every matter of transgression, concerning an ox, concerning a donkey, concerning a sheep, concerning clothing, concerning every lost property about which someone says, “Surely this is it,” the matter of both parties shall come to God. Whomever God declares guilty shall compensate his neighbor double.

title: Exodus 22:10
content: 10 If a man gives to his neighbor a donkey or an ox or a sheep or any animal to keep, and it dies or is hurt or is carried away without a witness,

title: Exodus 22:11
content: 11 there shall be an oath of Yahweh between both of them, whether or not he stretched out his hand against the property of his neighbor. Its owner must accept, and he shall not compensate.

title: Exodus 22:12
content: 12 But if it was truly stolen from him, he shall compensate its owner.

title: Exodus 22:13
content: 13 If it was truly torn, he shall bring it as evidence. He shall not compensate for what was torn.

title: Exodus 22:14
content: 14 If a man borrows from his neighbor and it is injured or dies without the owner with it, he shall surely compensate.

title: Exodus 22:15
content: 15 If its owner was with it, he shall not compensate; if it was for hire, it came for its hiring fee.

title: Exodus 22:16
content: 16 If a man seduces a virgin who is not engaged, and if he lies with her, he shall surely pay her bride price to make her his wife.

title: Exodus 22:17
content: 17 If her father completely refuses to give her to him, he shall weigh out silver equal to the bride price of virgins.

title: Exodus 22:18
content: 18 You shall not allow a sorceress to live.

title: Exodus 22:19
content: 19 Any lier with an animal shall surely be put to death.

title: Exodus 22:20
content: 20 A sacrificer to the gods except to Yahweh alone shall be completely destroyed.

title: Exodus 22:21
content: 21 You shall not wrong a sojourner and you shall not oppress him, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus 22:22
content: 22 You shall not afflict any widow or fatherless child.

title: Exodus 22:23
content: 23 If you actually afflict them, and if they actually cry out to me, I will surely hear their cry,

title: Exodus 22:24
content: 24 and my nose will burn, and I will kill you with the sword; your wives will become widows, and your sons will become fatherless.

title: Exodus 22:25
content: 25 If you lend silver to my people, the poor with you, you shall not be like a creditor to him—you shall not put interest on him.

title: Exodus 22:26
content: 26 If you actually take the clothing of your neighbor in pledge, you shall return it to him before the sun goes down,

title: Exodus 22:27
content: 27 for it is his only covering; it is his clothing for his skin. In what will he lie down? And it will be when he cries to me, that I will hear him, for I am gracious.

title: Exodus 22:28
content: 28 You shall not act contemptuously toward God, and you shall not curse a ruler of your people.

title: Exodus 22:29
content: 29 You shall not hold back from your full harvest or your presses. You shall give the firstborn of your sons to me.

title: Exodus 22:30
content: 30 You shall do the same to your ox and to your sheep. Seven days it will be with its mother; on the eighth day you shall give it to me.

title: Exodus 22:31
content: 31 And you shall be men of holiness to me. And you shall not eat animal-torn-in-the-field meat. You shall throw it to the dogs.

title: Exodus 23:1
content: 1 You shall not take up a report of emptiness. You shall not put your hand with the wicked to be a witness of violence.

title: Exodus 23:2
content: 2 You shall not follow a crowd into evil, nor shall you testify on legal matters to turn aside behind the crowd that turns aside.

title: Exodus 23:3
content: 3 And you shall not favor the poor in his lawsuit.

title: Exodus 23:4
content: 4 If you meet the ox of your enemy or his donkey going astray, you shall certainly bring it back to him.

title: Exodus 23:5
content: 5 If you see the donkey of someone who hates you fallen to the ground under its load, you shall refrain from leaving him. You shall surely release it with him.

title: Exodus 23:6
content: 6 You shall not turn aside justice for your poor in his lawsuit.

title: Exodus 23:7
content: 7 You shall be far from a word of deception, and you shall not kill the innocent or righteous, for I will not justify the wicked.

title: Exodus 23:8
content: 8 And you shall not take a bribe, for the bribe blinds the clear-sighted, and it perverts the words of the righteous.

title: Exodus 23:9
content: 9 And you shall not oppress a foreigner, since you yourself know the soul of the foreigner, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus 23:10
content: 10 And six years you shall sow your land and gather its produce.

title: Exodus 23:11
content: 11 But the seventh you shall let it drop and leave it alone, and the poor of your people shall eat. And the living things of the field shall eat the reminder. You shall do thus to your vineyard and to your olive orchard.

title: Exodus 23:12
content: 12 Six days you shall do your work, and on the seventh day you shall rest so that your ox and your donkey may rest, and the son of your female slave and the sojourner may be refreshed.

title: Exodus 23:13
content: 13 You shall take heed to everything that I have said to you. You shall not mention the names of other gods, nor let them be heard on your mouth.

title: Exodus 23:14
content: 14 You shall celebrate me three times every year.

title: Exodus 23:15
content: 15 You shall keep the Festival of Unleavened Bread. You shall eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded you, at the appointed time, the month of Aviv, for in it you came out from Egypt. And you shall not appear at my face empty-handed.

title: Exodus 23:16
content: 16 And {you shall keep} the Festival of the Harvest, {bringing} the first fruits of your labors which you sowed in the field. And {you shall keep} the Festival of the Gathering in the exiting of the year, {bringing} in your gathering of your labors from the field.

title: Exodus 23:17
content: 17 Three times in a year, all your males shall appear to the face of the Lord Yahweh.

title: Exodus 23:18
content: 18 You shall not sacrifice the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread, and the fat of my festival shall not remain all night until morning.

title: Exodus 23:19
content: 19 You shall bring the first of the firstfruits of your ground to the house of Yahweh your God. You shall not boil a young goat in the milk of its mother.

title: Exodus 23:20
content: 20 Behold, I am about to send an angel before your face to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have prepared.

title: Exodus 23:21
content: 21 Be guarded from his face and listen to his voice. Do not cause bitterness in him, for he will not bear with your transgressions, for my name is within him.

title: Exodus 23:22
content: 22 For if you indeed heed his voice and do everything that I speak, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and I will be an adversary to your adversaries.

title: Exodus 23:23
content: 23 For my angel will go before your face and bring you to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites and the Canaanites, the Hivites and the Jebusites. I will annihilate them.

title: Exodus 23:24
content: 24 You shall not bow down to their gods, and you shall not serve them, and you shall not do as they do. For you shall completely overthrow them and completely smash their stone pillars.

title: Exodus 23:25
content: 25 And you shall serve Yahweh your God, and he will bless your bread and your water. And I will remove sickness from among you.

title: Exodus 23:26
content: 26 There will not be a miscarriage or a barren woman in your land. I will fulfill the number of your days.

title: Exodus 23:27
content: 27 I will send my terror before your face, and I will confuse all of the people into whom you will go, and I will give the back of the neck of all of your enemies to you.

title: Exodus 23:28
content: 28 And I will send the hornet before your face, and it will drive out the Hivites, Canaanites, and the Hittites from before your face.

title: Exodus 23:29
content: 29 I will not drive them out from before your face in one year, lest the land become desolate and the animals of the field become too many for you.

title: Exodus 23:30
content: 30 I will drive them out little by little from before your face until you become fruitful and possess the land.

title: Exodus 23:31
content: 31 And I will set your borders from the Sea of Reeds to the sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness to the river. For I will give the inhabitants of the land into your hand. And you will drive them out from before your faces.

title: Exodus 23:32
content: 32 You shall not make a covenant with them or with their gods.

title: Exodus 23:33
content: 33 They shall not live in your land, lest they cause you to sin against me; for you will serve their gods. Surely it will become a snare for you.’”

title: Exodus 24:1
content: 1 And he said to Moses, “Come up to Yahweh—you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu and seventy from the elders of Israel, and you shall bow down from a distance.

title: Exodus 24:2
content: 2 And Moses alone shall come near to Yahweh, and they shall not come near, and the people shall not come up with him.”

title: Exodus 24:3
content: 3 And Moses went and recounted to the people all of the words of Yahweh and all of the ordinances. And all of the people answered with one voice and said, “We will do all the things that Yahweh has spoken.”

title: Exodus 24:4
content: 4 And Moses wrote all of the words of Yahweh. And he rose early in the morning and built an altar at the bottom of the mountain and twelve stone pillars according to the twelve tribes of Israel.

title: Exodus 24:5
content: 5 He sent the young men of the sons of Israel, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of bulls to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 24:6
content: 6 And Moses took half of the blood and put it into basins and sprinkled half of the blood onto the altar.

title: Exodus 24:7
content: 7 And he took the Book of the Covenant and read it aloud in the ears of the people. And they said, “We will do and hear all that Yahweh has spoken.”

title: Exodus 24:8
content: 8 And Moses took the blood and sprinkled it onto the people. And he said, “Behold! the blood of the covenant that Yahweh has cut with you according to all of these words.”

title: Exodus 24:9
content: 9 And Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu and seventy from the elders of Israel went up.

title: Exodus 24:10
content: 10 And they saw the God of Israel. And under his feet was like tile made of sapphire, and its substance was as the sky in purity.

title: Exodus 24:11
content: 11 And he did not send out his hand to the leaders of the sons of Israel. And they saw God, and they ate and drank.

title: Exodus 24:12
content: 12 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Come up to me to the mountain and be there. And I will give you the tablets of stone and the law and the commandments that I have written to teach them.”

title: Exodus 24:13
content: 13 And Moses and his servant Joshua got up, and Moses went up to the mountain of God.

title: Exodus 24:14
content: 14 And he had said to the elders, “Wait for us in this place until we return to you. And behold! Aaron and Hur are with you; Whoever is a master of words may come near to them.”

title: Exodus 24:15
content: 15 And Moses went up to the mountain, and a cloud covered the mountain.

title: Exodus 24:16
content: 16 And the glory of Yahweh settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days. And on the seventh day he called to Moses from within the cloud.

title: Exodus 24:17
content: 17 And the appearance of the glory of Yahweh was like a devouring fire on the top of the mountain in the eyes of the sons of Israel.

title: Exodus 24:18
content: 18 And Moses entered the middle of the cloud and went up to the mountain. And Moses was on the mountain 40 days and 40 nights.

title: Exodus 25:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Exodus 25:2
content: 2 “Speak to the sons of Israel, and they shall take a contribution for me. You shall take my contribution from every man whose heart incites him.

title: Exodus 25:3
content: 3 And these are the contributions that you shall receive from them: gold and silver and bronze

title: Exodus 25:4
content: 4 and blue and purple and worm of scarlet and fine linen and goats’ hair

title: Exodus 25:5
content: 5 and reddened hides of rams and hides of sea cows and wood of acacias,

title: Exodus 25:6
content: 6 oil for the light; spices for the oil of anointing and for the incense of fragrance;

title: Exodus 25:7
content: 7 stones of onyx and precious stones for settings for the ephod and for the breastpiece.

title: Exodus 25:8
content: 8 And they shall make a sanctuary for me, and I shall live in their midst,

title: Exodus 25:9
content: 9 according to all that I am about to show you—the pattern of the Dwelling and the pattern of all of its utensils—and thus you shall make it.

title: Exodus 25:10
content: 10 And they shall make a box of wood of acacias—its length: two cubits and a half; and its width: one cubit and a half; and its height: one cubit and a half.

title: Exodus 25:11
content: 11 And you shall overlay it {with} pure gold, inside and outside you shall overlay it, and you shall make on it a border of gold around {it}.

title: Exodus 25:12
content: 12 And you shall cast four rings of gold for it and put {them} on its four feet: two rings on its one side and two rings on its second side.

title: Exodus 25:13
content: 13 And you shall make poles of wood of acacias and overlay them {with} gold.

title: Exodus 25:14
content: 14 And you shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the box, to carry the box with them.

title: Exodus 25:15
content: 15 The poles shall be in the rings of the ark; they shall not be removed from it.

title: Exodus 25:16
content: 16 And you shall put into the box the Testimony that I give to you.

title: Exodus 25:17
content: 17 And you shall make an atonement lid of pure gold—its length: two cubits and a half; and its width: a cubit and a half.

title: Exodus 25:18
content: 18 And you shall make two gold cherubim. You shall make them of hammered work from the two ends of the atonement lid.

title: Exodus 25:19
content: 19 And make one cherub from this end and one cherub from this end. You shall make the cherubim from the atonement lid on its two ends.

title: Exodus 25:20
content: 20 And the cherubim shall be spreading out their wings upward, covering over the atonement lid with their wings and their faces {shall} each {be} toward his brother. The faces of the cherubim shall be toward the atonement lid.

title: Exodus 25:21
content: 21 And you shall put the atonement lid on the box from above, and you shall put into the box the Testimony that I give to you.

title: Exodus 25:22
content: 22 And I will meet with you there and I will speak with you all that I will command you for the sons of Israel from above the atonement lid, from between the two cherubim which are above the Box of the Testimony.

title: Exodus 25:23
content: 23 And you shall make a table from wood of acacias. Its length: two cubits, and its width: a cubit, and its height: a cubit and a half.

title: Exodus 25:24
content: 24 And you shall overlay it {with} pure gold, and you shall make for it a border of gold around {it}.

title: Exodus 25:25
content: 25 And you shall make a rim for it, a handbreadth all around, and you shall make a border of gold around its rim.

title: Exodus 25:26
content: 26 And you shall make four rings of gold for it and put the rings on the four corners, where its four legs are.

title: Exodus 25:27
content: 27 The rings shall be close to the rim to house the poles to carry the table.

title: Exodus 25:28
content: 28 And you shall make the poles {out of} wood of acacias and cover them {with} gold, and the table shall be carried with them.

title: Exodus 25:29
content: 29 And you shall make its plates and its pans and its pitchers and its bowls with which it will be poured out. You shall make them {from} pure gold.

title: Exodus 25:30
content: 30 And you shall continually put the bread of faces on the table before my face.

title: Exodus 25:31
content: 31 And you shall make a lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand—its base and its shaft—shall be made of hammered work. Its cups, its buds, and its blossoms shall be from it.

title: Exodus 25:32
content: 32 And six branches go out from its sides—three branches of the lampstand from the one side and three branches of the lampstand from the second side.

title: Exodus 25:33
content: 33 Three cups, shaped like almond blossoms, shall be on the one branch, a bulb, and a blossom. And three cups, shaped like almond blossoms, shall be on the one branch, a bulb, and a blossom—thus for the six branches going out from the lampstand.

title: Exodus 25:34
content: 34 And on the lampstand there shall be four cups shaped like almond blossoms {with} its bulbs and its blossoms,

title: Exodus 25:35
content: 35 And a bulb will be under two of the branches from it, and a bulb will be under two of the branches from it, and a bulb will be under two of the branches from it—for all six branches extending out from the lampstand.

title: Exodus 25:36
content: 36 Their bulbs and their branches from it shall all be one piece of hammered work of pure gold.

title: Exodus 25:37
content: 37 And you shall make its seven lamps, and it will hold up its lamps, and it will make light on the side of its face.

title: Exodus 25:38
content: 38 And {make} its tongs and its trays of pure gold.

title: Exodus 25:39
content: 39 He shall make it, all these items, from a talent of pure gold.

title: Exodus 25:40
content: 40 See and make by the pattern that you are being shown on the mountain.

title: Exodus 26:1
content: 1 And the Dwelling you shall make with ten curtains: twisted fine linen and blue and purple and worm of scarlet; cherubim—the work of a skilled craftsman you shall make them.

title: Exodus 26:2
content: 2 The length of each curtain shall be 28 cubits and the width of each curtain shall be 4 cubits. All of the curtains shall be one size.

title: Exodus 26:3
content: 3 Five of the curtains shall be joined each to another and five of the curtains joined each to another.

title: Exodus 26:4
content: 4 And you shall make loops of blue on the edge of the first curtain from the edge in the set. And you shall do thus along the edge of the end curtain in the second set.

title: Exodus 26:5
content: 5 You shall make 50 loops on the first curtain, and you shall make 50 loops on the end of the curtain which is in the second set. The loops should be opposite woman to her sister.

title: Exodus 26:6
content: 6 And you shall make 50 clasps of gold and join the curtains woman to her sister with the clasps, and the Dwelling will be one.

title: Exodus 26:7
content: 7 And you shall make curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the Dwelling. You shall make 11 of these curtains.

title: Exodus 26:8
content: 8 The length of each curtain {shall be} 30 cubits, and the width of each curtain {shall be} 4 cubits. The 11 curtains {shall be} the same size.

title: Exodus 26:9
content: 9 And you shall join five curtains to each other and six curtains to each other. And you shall double over the sixth curtain at the front of the face of the tent.

title: Exodus 26:10
content: 10 And you shall make 50 loops on the edge of the one end curtain in the joined set and 50 loops on the edge of the curtain in the second joined set.

title: Exodus 26:11
content: 11 And you shall make 50 clasps of bronze and put the clasps in the loops and join them and the tent will be one.

title: Exodus 26:12
content: 12 And the remaining excess curtain of the tent, the half curtain remaining, shall hang over the back of the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 26:13
content: 13 And a cubit from this side and a cubit from that side, the excess of the length of the curtains of the tent shall hang over the sides of the Dwelling from this side and from that side, to cover it.

title: Exodus 26:14
content: 14 And you shall make a covering for the tent of reddened hides of rams, and a covering of hides of sea-cows above that.

title: Exodus 26:15
content: 15 And you shall make upright frames for the Dwelling from wood of acacias.

title: Exodus 26:16
content: 16 The length of a frame shall be ten cubits, and the width of one frame shall be a cubit and a half of a cubit.

title: Exodus 26:17
content: 17 There shall be two tenons in each frame for joining a woman to her sister. Thus you shall make all of the frames of the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 26:18
content: 18 And you shall make the frames for the Dwelling: 20 frames for the south side.

title: Exodus 26:19
content: 19 And you shall make 40 bases of silver under the 20 frames: two bases under one frame for its two tenons, and two bases under one frame for its two tenons.

title: Exodus 26:20
content: 20 And for the second side of the Dwelling, on the north side: 20 frames

title: Exodus 26:21
content: 21 and their 40 silver bases: two bases under one frame and two bases under one frame.

title: Exodus 26:22
content: 22 And you shall make six frames for the back side of the Dwelling, toward the west.

title: Exodus 26:23
content: 23 And you shall make two frames for the back corners of the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 26:24
content: 24 And they shall be a pair at the bottom, and they shall be completely together at the top to one ring. Thus it shall be for both; the two shall be the corners.

title: Exodus 26:25
content: 25 And there shall be eight frames and their silver bases, sixteen bases: two bases under one frame and two bases under one frame.

title: Exodus 26:26
content: 26 And you shall make crossbars of wood of acacias—five for the frames of the one side of the Dwelling,

title: Exodus 26:27
content: 27 and five crossbars for the frames of the second side of the Dwelling, and five crossbars for the frames for the back side of the Dwelling to the west.

title: Exodus 26:28
content: 28 And the middle crossbar in the center of the frames shall pass through from end to end.

title: Exodus 26:29
content: 29 And you shall cover the frames with gold. And you shall make their rings of gold, the holders for the crossbars. And you shall cover the bars with gold.

title: Exodus 26:30
content: 30 And you shall set up the Dwelling according to its plan that you were shown on the mountain.

title: Exodus 26:31
content: 31 And you shall make a curtain of blue, and purple and worm of scarlet and of twisted fine linen; the work of a skillful workman, he shall make cherubim.

title: Exodus 26:32
content: 32 And you shall hang it on four pillars of acacia wood covered with gold and their hooks of gold on four bases of silver.

title: Exodus 26:33
content: 33 And you shall hang the curtain under the clasps, and you shall bring the Box of the Testimony there inside the curtain. And the curtain shall separate for you between the Holy and the Holy of Holies.

title: Exodus 26:34
content: 34 And you shall put the atonement lid on the Box of the Testimony in the Holy of Holies.

title: Exodus 26:35
content: 35 And you shall put the table outside the curtain and the lampstand opposite the table on the south side of the Dwelling. And put the table on the north side.

title: Exodus 26:36
content: 36 And you shall make a curtain for the entrance of the tent of blue and purple and worm of scarlet and of twisted fine linen, the work of an embroiderer.

title: Exodus 26:37
content: 37 And you shall make five pillars of acacia wood for the curtain, and you shall overlay them with gold, and their hooks {shall be} gold, and you shall cast five bases of bronze for them.

title: Exodus 27:1
content: 1 And you shall make the altar of wood of acacias, five cubits long and five cubits wide. The altar shall be square and three cubits high.

title: Exodus 27:2
content: 2 And you shall make its horns on its four corners; its horns will be part of it. And you shall overlay it with bronze.

title: Exodus 27:3
content: 3 And you shall make its pots for fatty ashes and its shovels and its basins and its meat forks and its trays. You shall make all its utensils with bronze.

title: Exodus 27:4
content: 4 And you shall make a grate for it, a work of a network of bronze. And you shall make four rings of bronze on the network, on its four corners.

title: Exodus 27:5
content: 5 And you shall put it under the ledge of the altar below, and the network shall be up to the middle of the altar.

title: Exodus 27:6
content: 6 And you shall make poles for the altar, poles of wood of acacias, and you shall overlay them with bronze.

title: Exodus 27:7
content: 7 And its poles shall be put into the rings, and the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar when carrying it.

title: Exodus 27:8
content: 8 You shall make it hollow, of planks. Just as he showed you on the mountain, so they shall do.

title: Exodus 27:9
content: 9 And you shall make the courtyard of the Dwelling. There shall be curtains of fine twisted linen on the south side of the courtyard; one side shall be 100 cubits long,

title: Exodus 27:10
content: 10 with its 20 pillars and their 20 bronze bases, the hooks of the pillars and their rings of silver.

title: Exodus 27:11
content: 11 And thus for the north side, the length of the curtains: 100 long, and its 20 pillars, 20 bases of bronze, hooks of the pillars, and rings of silver.

title: Exodus 27:12
content: 12 And the width of the courtyard, on the west side, shall have a curtain 50 cubits long with its ten pillars and ten bases.

title: Exodus 27:13
content: 13 And the width of the courtyard, on the east side, shall be 50 cubits.

title: Exodus 27:14
content: 14 The curtains for the side {shall be} fifteen cubits {with} their three pillars and their three bases.

title: Exodus 27:15
content: 15 The curtains for the second side shall be fifteen with their three pillars and their three bases.

title: Exodus 27:16
content: 16 And the gate of the courtyard shall be a curtain 20 cubits wide of blue and purple and worm of scarlet and of twisted fine linen—the work of an embroiderer—with its four pillars and its four bases.

title: Exodus 27:17
content: 17 All the pillars of the courtyard shall be filleted around with silver, and their silver hooks, and their bases of bronze.

title: Exodus 27:18
content: 18 The length of the courtyard shall be 100 cubits, and the width 50, and the height five cubits with fine twined linen, and bases of bronze.

title: Exodus 27:19
content: 19 All of the equipment of the Dwelling for all of its service, and all of its tent pegs and all of the pegs of the courtyard shall be bronze.

title: Exodus 27:20
content: 20 And you shall command the sons of Israel and they shall bring pure pressed oil of olive to you for the lamp, to cause the lamp to burn continually.

title: Exodus 27:21
content: 21 In the tent of meeting, outside the curtain inside of which is the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall arrange it before the face of Yahweh, from evening to morning. This is an eternal statute throughout the generations of the sons of Israel.

title: Exodus 28:1
content: 1 And you, bring Aaron your brother, and his sons with him near to you from among the sons of Israel to be priests for me—Aaron and Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron!

title: Exodus 28:2
content: 2 And you shall make for Aaron your brother clothes of holiness for glory and for splendor.

title: Exodus 28:3
content: 3 And you, you shall speak to all of the wise of heart, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, and they shall make the clothes of Aaron to set him apart to be a priest for me.

title: Exodus 28:4
content: 4 And these are the clothes that they shall make: a breastpiece and an ephod and a robe and a tunic of woven work, a turban and a sash. And they shall make clothes of holiness for your brother Aaron and for his sons to be priests for me.

title: Exodus 28:5
content: 5 And they shall take gold and blue and purple and worm of scarlet and fine linen.

title: Exodus 28:6
content: 6 And they shall make the ephod from gold, blue, and purple, worm of scarlet, and twisted fine linen—the work of a skillful craftsman.

title: Exodus 28:7
content: 7 It shall have two shoulder pieces joining to its two ends; so it shall be joined.

title: Exodus 28:8
content: 8 And the skillfully-crafted sash of the ephod which is on it shall be of like workmanship, from it: of gold, blue and purple and worm of scarlet and fine twined linen.

title: Exodus 28:9
content: 9 And you shall take two stones of onyx and you shall engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel,

title: Exodus 28:10
content: 10 six of their names on one stone and the six remaining names on the second stone, according to their genealogies.

title: Exodus 28:11
content: 11 You shall engrave the two stones with the names of the sons of Israel—the work of a craftsman of stone, the engravings of a signet. You shall make them surrounded with ornamental settings of gold.

title: Exodus 28:12
content: 12 And you shall put the two stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as stones of reminder for the sons of Israel. And Aaron shall carry their names before the face of Yahweh on his two shoulders for a reminder.

title: Exodus 28:13
content: 13 And you shall make ornamental settings of gold

title: Exodus 28:14
content: 14 and two twisted chains of pure gold: you shall make them as a work of rope, and you shall attach the chains of the rope to the ornamental settings.

title: Exodus 28:15
content: 15 And you shall make a breastpiece of judgment—the work of a skillful craftsman—you shall make it like the work of the ephod; you shall make it from gold, blue, and purple, and worm of scarlet, and twisted fine linen.

title: Exodus 28:16
content: 16 It shall be square, folded double; its length: a span; and its width: a span.

title: Exodus 28:17
content: 17 And you shall set in it settings of precious stone—four stone rows. The first row shall be a row with a ruby, a topaz, and a garnet.

title: Exodus 28:18
content: 18 And the second row: an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.

title: Exodus 28:19
content: 19 And the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst.

title: Exodus 28:20
content: 20 And the fourth row: a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper. They shall be set in gold—in their ornamental settings.

title: Exodus 28:21
content: 21 And the precious stones shall be according to the names of the sons of Israel—according to their 12 names. Each shall be like the engraving of a signet according to its name—for the 12 tribes.

title: Exodus 28:22
content: 22 And you shall make twisted chains on the breastpiece, as a work of rope—pure gold.

title: Exodus 28:23
content: 23 And you shall make two rings of gold for the breastpiece, and you shall put the two rings on the two ends of the breastpiece.

title: Exodus 28:24
content: 24 And you shall attach the two chains of gold to the rings on the two ends of the breastpiece.

title: Exodus 28:25
content: 25 And you shall attach two of the ends of the two chains to the two ornamental settings, and you shall attach those to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front of its face.

title: Exodus 28:26
content: 26 And you shall make two rings of gold, and you shall put them on the two ends of the breastpiece, on the edge which is toward the inner side of the ephod.

title: Exodus 28:27
content: 27 And you shall make two rings of gold, and you shall put them on the two shoulder-pieces of the ephod on the bottom of the front of its face, close to its joining above the skillfully crafted waistband of the ephod.

title: Exodus 28:28
content: 28 And they shall tie the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a cord of blue to be on the finely crafted waistband of the ephod, so the breastpiece shall not become detached from on the ephod.

title: Exodus 28:29
content: 29 And Aaron shall bear the names of the sons of Israel in the breastpiece of judgment over his heart when he goes into the Holy Place as a reminder before the face of Yahweh continually.

title: Exodus 28:30
content: 30 And you shall put the Urim and the Thummim in the breastpiece of judgment, and they shall be over the heart of Aaron when he goes in before the face of Yahweh. And Aaron shall bear the judgment of the sons of Israel over his heart before the face of Yahweh continually.

title: Exodus 28:31
content: 31 And you shall make the robe of the ephod entirely of blue.

title: Exodus 28:32
content: 32 And there shall be an opening for his head in the middle of it. There shall be an edge for its opening all around, so it can not tear—the work of a weaver, it shall be like an opening of a garment.

title: Exodus 28:33
content: 33 And on its bottom hem you shall make pomegranates of blue, purple, and worm of scarlet all around on its hem with bells of gold between them all around:

title: Exodus 28:34
content: 34 a bell of gold and a pomegranate, a bell of gold and a pomegranate all around the hem of the robe.

title: Exodus 28:35
content: 35 And it shall be on Aaron while serving, and its sound shall be heard at his going into the Holy Place before the face of Yahweh and at his leaving. And he shall not die.

title: Exodus 28:36
content: 36 And you shall make a rosette of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engraving on a signet, ‘Holy to Yahweh.’

title: Exodus 28:37
content: 37 And you shall attach it by a cord of blue, and it shall be on the turban. It shall be toward the front of the face of the turban.

title: Exodus 28:38
content: 38 And it shall be on the forehead of Aaron, and Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things which the sons of Israel shall cause to be holy, for all of the gifts of their holy things, and it shall be on his forehead continually for their acceptance before the face of Yahweh.

title: Exodus 28:39
content: 39 And you shall weave the tunic with fine linen, and you shall make a turban of fine linen. And you shall make a sash, the work of an embroiderer.

title: Exodus 28:40
content: 40 And for the sons of Aaron you shall make tunics, and you shall make sashes for them, and you shall make headbands for them for glory and for splendor.

title: Exodus 28:41
content: 41 And you shall clothe them, your brother Aaron and his sons with him. And you shall anoint them, and you shall fill their hand, and you shall set them apart to be priests to me.

title: Exodus 28:42
content: 42 And make for them undergarments of linen to cover the flesh of nakedness—they shall be from the waist to the thighs.

title: Exodus 28:43
content: 43 And they shall be on Aaron and on his sons at their entering into the tent of meeting or at their drawing near to the altar to serve in the Holy Place. And they shall not bear iniquity and die. This is a statute forever for him and for his offspring after him.

title: Exodus 29:1
content: 1 And this {is} the thing that you shall do to them to set them apart to be priests to me. Take one bull, a son of the herd, and two unblemished rams

title: Exodus 29:2
content: 2 and unleavened bread and unleavened cakes mixed with oil and unleavened wafers rubbed with oil. Make them with fine flour of wheat.

title: Exodus 29:3
content: 3 And you shall put them into one basket, and you shall bring them near in the basket, and the bull and the two rams.

title: Exodus 29:4
content: 4 And you shall bring Aaron and his sons near to the entrance of the tent of meeting. And you shall wash them with water.

title: Exodus 29:5
content: 5 And you shall take the garments, and you shall clothe Aaron with the tunic and the robe of the ephod and the ephod and the breastpiece, and you shall fasten the ephod to him with the finely woven waistband of the ephod.

title: Exodus 29:6
content: 6 And you shall set the turban on his head and put the crown of holiness on the turban.

title: Exodus 29:7
content: 7 And you shall take the oil of anointing and pour it on his head and anoint him.

title: Exodus 29:8
content: 8 And you shall bring his sons and clothe them with tunics.

title: Exodus 29:9
content: 9 And you shall wrap them—Aaron and his sons—with the sash and bind headbands to them. And the priesthood will be to them as a statute forever. And you shall fill the hand of Aaron and the hand of his sons.

title: Exodus 29:10
content: 10 And you shall bring the bull to the face of the tent of meeting, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the bull.

title: Exodus 29:11
content: 11 And you shall slaughter the bull before the face of Yahweh at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

title: Exodus 29:12
content: 12 And you shall take from the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and you shall pour out all of the blood on the base of the altar.

title: Exodus 29:13
content: 13 And you shall take all of the fat covering the entrails and the lobe above the liver and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, and cause them to become smoke on the altar.

title: Exodus 29:14
content: 14 But you shall burn the flesh of the bull and its skin and its dung in the fire outside of the camp. It is a purification offering.

title: Exodus 29:15
content: 15 And you shall take one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram,

title: Exodus 29:16
content: 16 and you shall slaughter the ram. And you shall take its blood and sprinkle it all around on the altar.

title: Exodus 29:17
content: 17 And you shall cut the ram into pieces and wash its entrails and its legs and put them on its pieces and on its head,

title: Exodus 29:18
content: 18 and cause all of the ram to become smoke on the altar. It is a burnt offering to Yahweh. It is a scent of appeasement, a fire offering to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 29:19
content: 19 And you shall take the second ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram,

title: Exodus 29:20
content: 20 and you shall slaughter the ram and take some of its blood. And you shall put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron and on the tip of the right ear of his sons and on the thumb of their right hand and on the great toe of their right foot. And you shall sprinkle the blood all around on the altar.

title: Exodus 29:21
content: 21 And you shall take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the oil of anointing and sprinkle it on Aaron and on his garments and on his sons and on the garments of his sons along with him. And he will be set apart and his garments and his sons and the garments of his sons along with him.

title: Exodus 29:22
content: 22 And you shall take the fat from the ram and the fat tail and the fat covering the entrails and the lobe of the liver and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them and the right thigh—for this is a ram of consecration—

title: Exodus 29:23
content: 23 and one round loaf of bread, and one cake of bread of oil, and one wafer from the basket of unleavened bread that is before the face of Yahweh.

title: Exodus 29:24
content: 24 And you shall put all these on the palms of Aaron and on the palms of his sons, and you shall raise them as a raised offering before the face of Yahweh.

title: Exodus 29:25
content: 25 And you shall take them from their hands, and cause them to become smoke on the altar above the burnt offering to be an aroma of appeasing before the face of Yahweh, it is a fire offering to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 29:26
content: 26 And you shall take the breast from the ram of consecration that is for Aaron and raise it for a raised offering before the face of Yahweh, and it will be your share.

title: Exodus 29:27
content: 27 And from the ram of consecration which is for Aaron and which is for his sons, you shall set apart the breast of the raised offering that was raised and the thigh of the contribution that was contributed.

title: Exodus 29:28
content: 28 And it shall belong to Aaron and to his sons—as an eternal requirement—for it is an offering from the sons of Israel. And it shall be an offering from the sons of Israel from the sacrifices of their peace offerings, their offerings to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 29:29
content: 29 And the garments of holiness that are for Aaron shall be for his sons after him, for anointing in them and to fill their hand in them.

title: Exodus 29:30
content: 30 The priest who succeeds him from among his sons, who comes into the tent of meeting to serve in the Holy Place, shall wear them for seven days.

title: Exodus 29:31
content: 31 And you shall take the ram of consecration and boil its meat in a holy place.

title: Exodus 29:32
content: 32 And Aaron and his sons shall eat the meat of the ram and the bread that is in the basket at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

title: Exodus 29:33
content: 33 And they shall eat these that were for their atoning to fill their hand, to set them apart. But a stranger shall not eat them, because they are set apart.

title: Exodus 29:34
content: 34 And if any meat of the consecration or any of the bread remains until the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire. It shall not be eaten, because it is set apart.

title: Exodus 29:35
content: 35 And thus you shall do to Aaron and to his sons according to all that I have commanded you: you shall fill their hand seven days.

title: Exodus 29:36
content: 36 And you shall offer a bull of purification for atonement daily, and you shall purify the altar by making atonement for it. And you shall anoint it to set it apart.

title: Exodus 29:37
content: 37 You shall make atonement for the altar seven days, and set it apart. And the altar will be a holiest holy thing. Whatever touches the altar will be set apart.

title: Exodus 29:38
content: 38 And this is what you shall offer on the altar every day continually: two lambs, sons of a year.

title: Exodus 29:39
content: 39 The one lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the second lamb you shall offer between the evenings.

title: Exodus 29:40
content: 40 For the first lamb: a tenth of fine flour mixed with pressed oil (the fourth part of a hin) and a drink offering: the fourth part of a hin of wine.

title: Exodus 29:41
content: 41 And you shall offer the second lamb between the evenings. You shall offer the same grain offering as in the morning and the same drink offering with it for a scent of appeasement, a fire offering to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 29:42
content: 42 It shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations, at the entrance to the tent of meeting before the face of Yahweh, there where I will meet with you to speak to you there.

title: Exodus 29:43
content: 43 And I will meet with the sons of Israel there, and it will be set apart by my glory.

title: Exodus 29:44
content: 44 And I will set apart the tent of meeting and the altar. And I will set apart Aaron and his sons to be priests to me.

title: Exodus 29:45
content: 45 And I will live among the sons of Israel and will be their God.

title: Exodus 29:46
content: 46 And they will know that I am Yahweh their God, who brought them out from the land of Egypt to live among them. I am Yahweh their God.

title: Exodus 30:1
content: 1 And you shall make an altar, a place of burning of incense. You shall make it with wood of acacias,

title: Exodus 30:2
content: 2 Its length shall be one cubit and its width shall be one cubit. It shall be square, and its height shall be two cubits. Its horns {shall be} part of it.

title: Exodus 30:3
content: 3 And you shall overlay it with pure gold—its top and all around its sides and its horns—and you shall make for it a border of gold around it.

title: Exodus 30:4
content: 4 And you shall make two rings of gold for it under its border on its two sides. You shall make them on its two sides. They will be housings for the poles for carrying it with.

title: Exodus 30:5
content: 5 And you shall make the poles of wood of acacias, and you shall overlay them with gold.

title: Exodus 30:6
content: 6 And you shall place it before the face of the curtain that is over the Box of the Testimony. It shall be before the face of the atonement lid that is over the Testimony, where I will meet with you.

title: Exodus 30:7
content: 7 And Aaron shall cause smoke on it, incense of fragrance. Morning by morning, when he makes the lamps good, he shall cause it to smoke,

title: Exodus 30:8
content: 8 and when Aaron lifts up the lamps between the evenings, he will make it smoke. Incense will be continually before the face of Yahweh throughout your generations.

title: Exodus 30:9
content: 9 You shall not offer up strange incense or a burnt offering or a grain offering on it. And you shall not pour a drink offering on it.

title: Exodus 30:10
content: 10 And Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once a year. From the blood of the purification of the atonement once a year he shall make atonement for it throughout your generations. It is a holiest holy thing to Yahweh.”

title: Exodus 30:11
content: 11 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Exodus 30:12
content: 12 “When you lift up the head of the sons of Israel to count them, then each man shall give the ransom of his life to Yahweh when counting them. And there will not be a plague among them when counting them.

title: Exodus 30:13
content: 13 Every passer over to the counted ones shall give this: half of a shekel, according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is 20 gerahs). The half shekel is an offering to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 30:14
content: 14 Every passer over to the counted ones, from a son of 20 years and up, shall give the contribution of Yahweh.

title: Exodus 30:15
content: 15 The rich shall not increase, and the poor shall not decrease from the half-shekel for giving the contribution of Yahweh to cover over your lives.

title: Exodus 30:16
content: 16 And you shall take the silver of ransoms from the sons of Israel, and you shall give it to the work of the tent of meeting. And it shall be as a reminder for the sons of Israel before the face of Yahweh to cover over your lives.”

title: Exodus 30:17
content: 17 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Exodus 30:18
content: 18 “And you shall make a basin of bronze and its base of bronze for washing. And you shall put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it.

title: Exodus 30:19
content: 19 And Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet in it.

title: Exodus 30:20
content: 20 When they go into the tent of meeting, they shall wash with water, and they will not die. Also when they go near to the altar to serve by causing a fire offering to Yahweh to smoke,

title: Exodus 30:21
content: 21 then they shall wash their hands and their feet, and they will not die. And this shall be a statute forever for them, for him and his offspring throughout their generations.”

title: Exodus 30:22
content: 22 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Exodus 30:23
content: 23 “As for you, take the best spices: myrrh of flowing, 500, and cinnamon of fragrance, its half, 250, and cane of fragrance, 250,

title: Exodus 30:24
content: 24 and cassia, 500, —according to the shekel of the sanctuary—and oil of olive, a hin.

title: Exodus 30:25
content: 25 And you shall make it {into} an oil of anointment of holiness, an ointment from an ointment mixture, the work of an ointment mixer. It shall be an oil of anointment of holiness.

title: Exodus 30:26
content: 26 And you shall anoint with it the tent of meeting and the Box of the Testimony

title: Exodus 30:27
content: 27 and the table and all of its utensils and the lampstand and its equipment and the altar of incense

title: Exodus 30:28
content: 28 and the altar of burnt offerings and all of its equipment and the basin and its stand.

title: Exodus 30:29
content: 29 And you shall set them apart, and they will be holiest holy things. Anything that touches them will be set apart.

title: Exodus 30:30
content: 30 And you shall anoint Aaron and his sons and set them apart to be priests to me.

title: Exodus 30:31
content: 31 And you shall speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘This will be my oil of anointment of holiness throughout your generations.

title: Exodus 30:32
content: 32 It shall not be poured on the body of a man, and you shall not make anything like it with its formula. It is holy; it shall be holy to you.

title: Exodus 30:33
content: 33 A man that mixes its like or that puts any of it on a stranger shall be cut off from his people.’”

title: Exodus 30:34
content: 34 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Take to yourself spices—stacte, and onycha, and galbanum—spices and pure frankincense. They shall each be in equal amounts.

title: Exodus 30:35
content: 35 And you shall make it {into} incense, an ointment, the work of an ointment mixer: salted, pure, holy.

title: Exodus 30:36
content: 36 And you shall pulverize some of it until pulverized. And you shall put some of it before the face of the testimony in the tent of meeting, where I will meet with you. It will be a holiest holy thing to you.

title: Exodus 30:37
content: 37 And the incense that you will make, you shall not make {any} with its formula for yourselves. It must be holy to Yahweh for you.

title: Exodus 30:38
content: 38 A man that makes its like to smell it shall be cut off from his people.”

title: Exodus 31:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Exodus 31:2
content: 2 “See, I have called by name Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah.

title: Exodus 31:3
content: 3 And I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with skill and with understanding and with knowledge and with all kinds of craftsmanship

title: Exodus 31:4
content: 4 to design designs, to work in gold and in silver and in bronze

title: Exodus 31:5
content: 5 and in carving of precious stones for setting and in carving of wood, to do all kinds of craftsmanship.

title: Exodus 31:6
content: 6 And behold, I have given with him Oholiab son of Ahisamak, from the tribe of Dan. And I have put skill into the hearts of all of the skilled of heart, and they shall make all that I have commanded you:

title: Exodus 31:7
content: 7 the tent of meeting and the Box of the Testimony, and the atonement lid that is on it and all of the furniture of the tent,

title: Exodus 31:8
content: 8 the table and its utensils and the pure lampstand and all its equipment and the altar of incense

title: Exodus 31:9
content: 9 and the altar of burnt offerings and all its equipment and the basin and its base

title: Exodus 31:10
content: 10 and the finely woven clothing and the clothing of holiness for Aaron the priest and the clothing of his sons to {be} priests

title: Exodus 31:11
content: 11 and the oil of anointing and the incense of fragrance for the sanctuary. They shall make according to all that I have commanded you.”

title: Exodus 31:12
content: 12 And Yahweh said to Moses, saying,

title: Exodus 31:13
content: 13 “And you, speak to the sons of Israel, saying: ‘Surely you shall keep my Sabbaths, for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations so that you may know that I am Yahweh, who sets you apart.

title: Exodus 31:14
content: 14 And you shall keep the Sabbath, for it is holy to you.’ The profaner of it shall surely be put to death, for every worker of work on it, that person shall be cut off from his people.

title: Exodus 31:15
content: 15 Work shall be done six days, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of Sabbath, holy to Yahweh. Every worker of work on the Sabbath day shall surely be put to death.

title: Exodus 31:16
content: 16 And the sons of Israel shall keep the Sabbath to celebrate the Sabbath throughout their generations. A covenant of eternity

title: Exodus 31:17
content: 17 is between me and the sons of Israel. It is a sign forever, for in six days Yahweh made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.”

title: Exodus 31:18
content: 18 And as he finished speaking with him on the mountain of Sinai, he gave to Moses the two tablets of the Testimony, tablets of stone, written by the finger of God.

title: Exodus 32:1
content: 1 And the people saw that Moses delayed in coming down from the mountain, and the people gathered themselves around Aaron and said to him, “Arise, make gods for us that shall go before our faces, for this Moses, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him.”

title: Exodus 32:2
content: 2 And Aaron said to them, “Tear off the rings of gold that are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters and bring them to me.”

title: Exodus 32:3
content: 3 And all the people tore the rings of gold off themselves that were on their ears and brought them to Aaron.

title: Exodus 32:4
content: 4 And he took it from their hand, and fashioned it with a tool, and he made a calf of molten metal. And they said, “These are your gods, Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt.”

title: Exodus 32:5
content: 5 And Aaron saw, and he built an altar before the face of it, and Aaron proclaimed and said, “Tomorrow will be a festival to Yahweh.”

title: Exodus 32:6
content: 6 And they arose early the next day and offered burnt offerings and brought peace offerings. And the people sat down to eat and to drink and got up to play.

title: Exodus 32:7
content: 7 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, “Go! Descend! For your people, whom you brought up from the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves.

title: Exodus 32:8
content: 8 They have quickly turned from the way that I commanded them. They have made a calf of molten metal for themselves and have bowed before it and sacrificed to it. And they have said, ‘These are your gods, Israel, that brought you up from the land of Egypt.’”

title: Exodus 32:9
content: 9 And Yahweh said to Moses, “I have seen this people, and behold, it is a people hard of neck.

title: Exodus 32:10
content: 10 So now, leave me alone! And let my nose burn against them, and I will destroy them. And I will make you into a great nation.”

title: Exodus 32:11
content: 11 But Moses entreated the face of Yahweh his God. And he said, “Yahweh, why does your nose burn against your people whom you have brought out from the land of Egypt with great power and with a strong hand?

title: Exodus 32:12
content: 12 Why should the Egyptians say, saying, ‘He brought them out with evil intent, to kill them in the mountains and to destroy them from on the face of the ground’? Turn from your burning nose and repent from the evil to your people.

title: Exodus 32:13
content: 13 Remember Abraham and Isaac and Israel, your servants that you swore to them by yourself and spoke to them, ‘I will cause your descendants to increase as the stars of the heavens, and I will give to your descendants all this land of which I have spoken. And they will inherit it forever.’”

title: Exodus 32:14
content: 14 Then Yahweh repented from the evil that he had spoken to do to his people.

title: Exodus 32:15
content: 15 And Moses turned and went down from the mountain and the two tablets of the testimony {were} in his hand. The tablets were written on both their sides, on this {side} and on that {side} they were written.

title: Exodus 32:16
content: 16 And the tablets, they {were} the work of God. And the writing, it {was} the writing of God, {it} was engraved on the tablets.

title: Exodus 32:17
content: 17 And Joshua heard the noise of the people in its shouting, and he said to Moses, “{There is} the noise of war in the camp.”

title: Exodus 32:18
content: 18 But Moses said, “There is not the sound of singing of strength, and there is not the sound of singing of weakness, the sound of singing I am hearing.”

title: Exodus 32:19
content: 19 And it happened, as he approached to the camp, that he saw the calf and dancing, and the nose of Moses burned, and he threw the tablets from his hands and shattered them under the mountain.

title: Exodus 32:20
content: 20 And he took the calf that they had made and burned {it} in the fire and ground {it} until it was fine and scattered {it} on the face of the water and caused the sons of Israel to drink {it}.

title: Exodus 32:21
content: 21 And Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you, that you have brought a great sin on them?”

title: Exodus 32:22
content: 22 And Aaron said, “Do not let {your} nose burn, my lord. You know the people, that it {is/was} in evil.

title: Exodus 32:23
content: 23 And they said to me, ‘Make for us a god that will go before our faces. As for this Moses, the man that brought us up from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him.’

title: Exodus 32:24
content: 24 And I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, take it off yourself.’ And they gave {it} to me, and I threw it in the fire, and this calf came out.”

title: Exodus 32:25
content: 25 And Moses saw the people, that it was let loose, for Aaron had let it loose, to mockery by the risers-up against them.

title: Exodus 32:26
