content: 26 And Moses stood in the gate of the camp and said, “Who {is} for Yahweh, to me!” And all of the sons of Levi gathered themselves to him.

title: Exodus 32:27
content: 27 And he said to them, “Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: ‘Each man put his sword on his side. Pass through and return from gate to gate in the camp and kill each his brother and each his companion and each his neighbor.’”

title: Exodus 32:28
content: 28 And the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses. And on that day about 3,000 men from the people fell.

title: Exodus 32:29
content: 29 And Moses said, “Fill your hand for Yahweh today! For a man {was} against his son and against his brother and for putting a blessing on yourselves today.”

title: Exodus 32:30
content: 30 And it happened the next day that Moses said to the people, “You have sinned a great sin. And now I will go up to Yahweh. Perhaps I can atone for your sin.”

title: Exodus 32:31
content: 31 And Moses returned to Yahweh and said, “Oh, this people has sinned a great sin and made themselves gods of gold.

title: Exodus 32:32
content: 32 But now, if you forgive their sin; but if not, please blot me out of your book that you have written.”

title: Exodus 32:33
content: 33 But Yahweh said to Moses, “Whoever that sinned against me, I will blot him out from my book.

title: Exodus 32:34
content: 34 So now go, lead the people to where I have spoken to you! Behold, my angel will go before your face. But on the day I visit them, then I will visit their sin on them.”

title: Exodus 32:35
content: 35 And Yahweh plagued the people because they had made the calf (that Aaron made).

title: Exodus 33:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, “Go, arise from here, you and the people whom you have brought up from the land of Egypt to the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your seed.’

title: Exodus 33:2
content: 2 And I will send an angel before your face, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites, Hivites and the Jebusites.

title: Exodus 33:3
content: 3 {Go} to a land flowing {with} milk and honey, but I will not go up in your midst, because you {are} a people hard of neck, lest I destroy you on the way.”

title: Exodus 33:4
content: 4 And the people heard this evil word, and they mourned, and each one did not put his ornaments on him.

title: Exodus 33:5
content: 5 And Yahweh {had} said to Moses, “Say to the sons of Israel, ‘You are a people hard of neck. {If} I went up among you {for} one moment, then I {would} destroy you. And now, take your ornaments down from on you, and I will know what I will do to you.’”

title: Exodus 33:6
content: 6 And the sons of Israel stripped themselves {of} their ornaments from Mount Horeb.

title: Exodus 33:7
content: 7 And Moses would take a tent and would pitch it on the outside of the camp, at a distance from the camp. And he called it the tent of meeting. And it happened, every seeker of Yahweh would go out to the tent of meeting that {was} on the outside of the camp.

title: Exodus 33:8
content: 8 And it happened as Moses went out to the tent, all the people would stand up and each would be stationed {at} the entrance of his tent, and they stared behind Moses until he went into the tent.

title: Exodus 33:9
content: 9 And it happened, as Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would come down and stand {at} the entrance of the tent, and he would speak with Moses.

title: Exodus 33:10
content: 10 And all of the people saw the pillar of cloud standing {at} the entrance of the tent, and all of the people would get up and bow down, each {at} the entrance of his tent.

title: Exodus 33:11
content: 11 And Yahweh would speak to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend. Then Moses would return to the camp, but his servant Joshua son of Nun, a young man, would not withdraw from the midst of the tent.

title: Exodus 33:12
content: 12 And Moses said to Yahweh, “See, you {have been} saying to me, ‘Take this people up,’ but you have not caused me to know whom you will send with me. And you have said, ‘I know you by name, and you have also found favor in my eyes.’

title: Exodus 33:13
content: 13 And now please, if I have found favor in your eyes, please cause me to know your ways, and I will know you so that I can find favor in your eyes. And see that this nation is your people.”

title: Exodus 33:14
content: 14 And he said, “My face will go, and I will cause rest for you.”

title: Exodus 33:15
content: 15 And he said to him, “If your face {is} not going, do not take us up from here.

title: Exodus 33:16
content: 16 And in what then will it be known that I have found favor in your eyes, I and your people? {Is it} not in your going with us? And I and your people shall be distinct from all of the people that {are} on the face of the earth.”

title: Exodus 33:17
content: 17 And Yahweh said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have spoken, for you have found favor in my eyes, and I know you by name.”

title: Exodus 33:18
content: 18 And he said, “Please show me your glory.”

title: Exodus 33:19
content: 19 And he said, “I myself will cause all my goodness to pass over above your face, and I will proclaim in the name of Yahweh before your face: and I will favor whom I will favor, and I will be compassionate to whom I will be compassionate.”

title: Exodus 33:20
content: 20 But he said, “You are not able to see my face, for mankind can not see me and live.”

title: Exodus 33:21
content: 21 And Yahweh said, “Behold, a place with me, and you shall station yourself on the rock.

title: Exodus 33:22
content: 22 And it will happen, while my glory passes over, that I will put you in a crevice of the rock, and my hand will cover over you until I have passed over.

title: Exodus 33:23
content: 23 Then I will take away my hand, and you will see my back, but my face will not be seen.”

title: Exodus 34:1
content: 1 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Carve for yourself two tablets of stone like the first. And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets that you broke.

title: Exodus 34:2
content: 2 And be ready by morning, and in the morning come up to Mount Sinai, and present yourself there to me on the top of the mountain.

title: Exodus 34:3
content: 3 And a man shall not come up with you and also let a man not be seen on all of the mountain. Also let not the flocks and the herds graze to the front of that mountain.”

title: Exodus 34:4
content: 4 And he carved two tablets of stone like the first, and Moses got up early in the morning and went up to Mount Sinai as Yahweh had commanded him. And he took the two tablets of stone in his hand.

title: Exodus 34:5
content: 5 And Yahweh came down in the cloud and stood with him there, and he pronounced in the name of Yahweh.

title: Exodus 34:6
content: 6 And Yahweh passed over above his face and proclaimed, “Yahweh, Yahweh, a God compassionate and gracious, long of nostril and abounding in covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness,

title: Exodus 34:7
content: 7 keeping covenant faithfulness to thousands, forgiving iniquity, transgression, and sin. But he will surely not acquit, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the sons and on the sons of the sons, on the third and on the fourth.”

title: Exodus 34:8
content: 8 And Moses hurried and bowed to the ground and prostrated himself.

title: Exodus 34:9
content: 9 And he said, “Please, if I have found favor in your eyes, my Lord, may my Lord please go among us, for this {is} a people hard of neck. And forgive our iniquity and our sin and inherit us.”

title: Exodus 34:10
content: 10 And he said, “Behold, I am about to cut a covenant: before all of your people, I will do wonders that have not been created in all of the earth and in all of the nations. And all of the people that you are in the midst of will see the work of Yahweh, for it {is} fear-filling, what I {am} doing with you.

title: Exodus 34:11
content: 11 Keep for yourself what I am commanding today. Behold I am about to drive out from before your face the Amorites and the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites.

title: Exodus 34:12
content: 12 Guard yourself, lest you cut a covenant with the inhabitant of the land where you are about to go into, lest he become as a trap in your midst.

title: Exodus 34:13
content: 13 Instead, their altars you shall break down, and their pillars you shall smash, and his Asherah poles you shall cut down.

title: Exodus 34:14
content: 14 For you shall not bow to another god, for Yahweh—Jealous {is} his name—he {is} a jealous God.

title: Exodus 34:15
content: 15 Lest you cut a covenant with the inhabitant of the land, and they prostitute after their gods and sacrifice to their gods, and he invite you, and you eat from his sacrifice

title: Exodus 34:16
content: 16 and take from his daughters for your sons, and his daughters prostitute after their gods and cause your sons to prostitute after their gods.

title: Exodus 34:17
content: 17 Do not make for yourselves gods of molten metal.

title: Exodus 34:18
content: 18 You shall keep the Festival of Unleavened Bread. You shall eat unleavened bread seven days, which I commanded you, at the appointed time, the month of Aviv, for in the month of Aviv you came out from Egypt.

title: Exodus 34:19
content: 19 All of the openers of the womb are mine {even from} all of your male livestock, the openers of cattle and of sheep.

title: Exodus 34:20
content: 20 And the opener of a donkey you shall ransom with a lamb. And if you do not ransom it, then you shall break his neck. You shall ransom all the firstborn of your sons. And you shall not appear at my face empty-handed.

title: Exodus 34:21
content: 21 Six days you shall labor, but on the seventh day you shall rest. In plowing time and in harvest time, you shall rest.

title: Exodus 34:22
content: 22 And you shall keep for yourself the Festival of Weeks {with} the first-fruits of the harvest of the wheat, and the Festival of the Gathering at the turning of the year.

title: Exodus 34:23
content: 23 Three times in a year, all your males shall appear before the face of the Lord Yahweh, God of Israel.

title: Exodus 34:24
content: 24 For I will drive out nations before your face and expand your borders. And a man will not desire your land when you go up to appear before the face of Yahweh your God three times in a year.

title: Exodus 34:25
content: 25 You shall not slaughter the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread, and the sacrifice of the Festival of the Passover shall not remain all night to the morning.

title: Exodus 34:26
content: 26 You shall bring the first of the first fruits of your ground to the house of Yahweh your God. You shall not boil a young goat in the milk of its mother.”

title: Exodus 34:27
content: 27 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Write these words for yourself, for over the mouth of these words I have cut a covenant with you and with Israel.”

title: Exodus 34:28
content: 28 And he was there with Yahweh 40 days and 40 nights; bread he did not eat and water he did not drink. And he wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten words.

title: Exodus 34:29
content: 29 And it happened, as Moses {was} descending from Mount Sinai, with the two tablets of the testimony in the hand of Moses as he {was} descending from the mountain, that Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone while speaking with him.

title: Exodus 34:30
content: 30 And Aaron and all of the sons of Israel saw Moses, and behold, the skin of his face shone! And they were afraid to come near to him.

title: Exodus 34:31
content: 31 And Moses called to them, and Aaron and all of the leaders among the congregation returned to him. And Moses spoke to them.

title: Exodus 34:32
content: 32 And after this, all of the sons of Israel approached, and he commanded them all that Yahweh had spoken with him on Mount Sinai.

title: Exodus 34:33
content: 33 And Moses finished from speaking with them, and he put a veil over his face.

title: Exodus 34:34
content: 34 And whenever Moses went before the face of Yahweh to speak with him, he would remove the veil until he came out. And he would come out, and he would speak to the sons of Israel what he had been commanded.

title: Exodus 34:35
content: 35 And the sons of Israel would see the face of Moses, that the skin of the face of Moses shone. And Moses would put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with him.

title: Exodus 35:1
content: 1 And Moses assembled all the congregation of the sons of Israel and said to them, “These are the things that Yahweh has commanded you to do.

title: Exodus 35:2
content: 2 Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day {there} shall be for you a holy Sabbath of rest to Yahweh. Every doer of work on it shall be put to death.

title: Exodus 35:3
content: 3 You shall not kindle a fire in any of your dwellings on the days of the Sabbath.”

title: Exodus 35:4
content: 4 And Moses said to all of the congregation of the sons of Israel, saying, “This {is} the thing that Yahweh commanded, saying,

title: Exodus 35:5
content: 5 Take from with you a contribution for Yahweh, every{one} willing of his heart. Let him bring the contribution of Yahweh: gold and silver and bronze

title: Exodus 35:6
content: 6 and blue and purple and worm of scarlet and fine linen and goats’ hair

title: Exodus 35:7
content: 7 and reddened hides of rams and hides of sea-cows and wood of acacias

title: Exodus 35:8
content: 8 and oil for the light and spices for the oil of anointing and for the incense of fragrance

title: Exodus 35:9
content: 9 and stones of onyx and precious stones for settings for the ephod and for the breastpiece.

title: Exodus 35:10
content: 10 And all of the wise of heart among you shall come and make all that Yahweh has commanded—

title: Exodus 35:11
content: 11 the Dwelling, its tent and its covering, its clasps and its frames, its bars, its pillars and its bases,

title: Exodus 35:12
content: 12 the box and its poles, the atonement lid and the curtain of covering,

title: Exodus 35:13
content: 13 the table and its poles and all of its equipment and the bread of the faces

title: Exodus 35:14
content: 14 and the lampstand of the light and its utensils and its lamps and the oil of the light

title: Exodus 35:15
content: 15 and the altar of incense and its poles and the oil of anointing and the incense of fragrance and the curtain of the entrance for the entrance of the Dwelling,

title: Exodus 35:16
content: 16 the altar of the burnt offering and the grate of bronze that {is} for it, its poles and all of its utensils, the basin and its base,

title: Exodus 35:17
content: 17 the curtains of the courtyard, its pillars and bases and the curtain of the gate of the courtyard,

title: Exodus 35:18
content: 18 the tent pegs of the Dwelling and the pegs of the courtyard and their ropes,

title: Exodus 35:19
content: 19 finely-woven clothing for serving in the Holy Place, the clothing of holiness for Aaron the priest and the clothing of his sons, to {be} priests.”

title: Exodus 35:20
content: 20 And all of the congregation of the sons of Israel went away from before the face of Moses.

title: Exodus 35:21
content: 21 And every man whose heart lifted him came. And all whose spirit impelled him brought the contribution of Yahweh for the work of the tent of meeting and for all of its service and for the clothing of holiness.

title: Exodus 35:22
content: 22 And men along with women came, all impelled of heart. They brought brooches and earrings and rings and ornaments, all of the things of gold. And every man that raised {did} as a raised offering of gold to Yahweh.

title: Exodus 35:23
content: 23 And every man with whom was found blue and purple and worm of scarlet and fine linen and goats’ hair and reddened ram skins and hides of sea-cows brought {them}.

title: Exodus 35:24
content: 24 All of the presenters {of} a contribution of silver and of bronze brought the contribution of Yahweh, and all with whom wood of acacias was found for all the work of the service brought {it}.

title: Exodus 35:25
content: 25 And every woman skilled of heart spun with her hands, and they brought the spun items, the blue and the purple the worm of scarlet and the fine linen.

title: Exodus 35:26
content: 26 All the women with skill whose hearts lifted them spun goats’ hair.

title: Exodus 35:27
content: 27 And the leaders brought the onyx stones and precious stones of setting for the ephod and for the breastpiece

title: Exodus 35:28
content: 28 and spice and the oil for light and for the oil of anointing and for the incense of fragrance.

title: Exodus 35:29
content: 29 The sons of Israel brought a freewill offering to Yahweh, every man and woman whose heart impelled them to bring {something} for all of the work which Yahweh had commanded {them} to do by the hand of Moses.

title: Exodus 35:30
content: 30 And Moses said to the sons of Israel, “See, Yahweh has called by name on Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah.

title: Exodus 35:31
content: 31 And he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with skill and with understanding and with knowledge and with all kinds of craftsmanship

title: Exodus 35:32
content: 32 and to design designs, to work in gold and in silver and in bronze

title: Exodus 35:33
content: 33 and in carving of precious stones for setting and in carving of wood, to do all kinds of craftsmanship of invention.

title: Exodus 35:34
content: 34 And he has put {it} in his heart to teach, he and Oholiab the son of Ahisamak, from the tribe of Dan.

title: Exodus 35:35
content: 35 He has filled them {with} skill of heart to do all of the work of a craftsman and of a skillful workman and of an embroiderer in the blue and in the purple and in the worm of scarlet and in the fine linen and of a weaver. {They are} doers of all work and designers of design.

title: Exodus 36:1
content: 1 And Bezalel and Oholiab and every man skilled of heart to whom Yahweh has given skill and understanding to know {how} to do all of the work of the service of the Holy Place shall do according to all that Yahweh has commanded.”

title: Exodus 36:2
content: 2 And Moses called to Bezalel and to Oholiab and to every man skilled of heart in whose heart Yahweh had put skill, all whose heart lifted him to come near to the work to do it,

title: Exodus 36:3
content: 3 and they took from before the face of Moses all of the contributions that the sons of Israel had brought for doing the work of the service of the Holy Place. And they continually brought a freewill offering to him in the morning in the morning.

title: Exodus 36:4
content: 4 So all the skilled doing all the work of the Holy Place came, every single man from the work that they were doing,

title: Exodus 36:5
content: 5 and they said to Moses, saying, “The people {are} bringing much more than enough for the service of the work that Yahweh has commanded {us} to do.”

title: Exodus 36:6
content: 6 And Moses commanded, and they caused a sound to pass through in the camp, saying, “A man and a woman shall not make any more work for the contribution of the Holy Place.” And the people were restrained from bringing.

title: Exodus 36:7
content: 7 And the work was sufficient for doing all their work, and there was excess.

title: Exodus 36:8
content: 8 And every skilled of heart among the doers of the work made the Dwelling with ten curtains: twisted fine linen and blue and purple and worm of scarlet; cherubim—the work of a skilled craftsman he made them.

title: Exodus 36:9
content: 9 The length of each curtain {was} 28 cubits and the width of each curtain {was} four cubits. All of the curtains {were} one size.

title: Exodus 36:10
content: 10 And five of the curtains were joined each to another, and five of the curtains were joined each to another.

title: Exodus 36:11
content: 11 And he made loops of blue on the edge of the first curtain from the edge in the set. And he did thus along the edge of the end curtain in the second set.

title: Exodus 36:12
content: 12 He made 50 loops on the first curtain, and he made 50 loops on the end of the curtain which is in the second set. The loops were opposite one to one.

title: Exodus 36:13
content: 13 And he made 50 clasps of gold and joined the curtains one to one with the clasps, and the Dwelling was one.

title: Exodus 36:14
content: 14 And he made curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the Dwelling. He made 11 of these curtains.

title: Exodus 36:15
content: 15 The length of each curtain {was} 30 cubits, and the width of each curtain {was} four cubits. The 11 curtains {were} the same size.

title: Exodus 36:16
content: 16 And he joined five curtains to each other and six curtains to each other.

title: Exodus 36:17
content: 17 And he made 50 loops on the edge of the end curtain in the joined set, and he made 50 loops on the edge of the curtain in the second joined set.

title: Exodus 36:18
content: 18 And he made 50 clasps of bronze to join the tent to be one.

title: Exodus 36:19
content: 19 And he made a covering for the tent of reddened hides of rams and a covering of hides of sea-cows above that.

title: Exodus 36:20
content: 20 And he made upright frames for the Dwelling from wood of acacias.

title: Exodus 36:21
content: 21 The length of a frame {was} ten cubits, and the width of one frame {was} a cubit and a half of a cubit.

title: Exodus 36:22
content: 22 {There were} two tenons in each frame for joining one to one. Thus he made all of the frames of the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 36:23
content: 23 And he made the frames for the Dwelling: 20 frames for the south side.

title: Exodus 36:24
content: 24 And he made 40 bases of silver under the 20 frames: two bases under one frame for its two tenons, and two bases under one frame for its two tenons.

title: Exodus 36:25
content: 25 And for the second side of the Dwelling, on the north side, he made 20 frames

title: Exodus 36:26
content: 26 and their 40 silver bases: two bases under one frame, and two bases under one frame.

title: Exodus 36:27
content: 27 And he made six frames for the back side of the Dwelling, toward the west.

title: Exodus 36:28
content: 28 And he made two frames for the back corners of the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 36:29
content: 29 And they were a pair at the bottom, and they were completely together at the top to one ring. Thus he did for both as the two corners.

title: Exodus 36:30
content: 30 And there were eight frames and their silver bases, sixteen bases: two bases, two bases under one frame.

title: Exodus 36:31
content: 31 And he made crossbars of wood of acacias—five for the frames of the one side of the Dwelling,

title: Exodus 36:32
content: 32 and five crossbars for the frames of the second side of the Dwelling, and five crossbars for the frames for the back of the Dwelling to the west.

title: Exodus 36:33
content: 33 And he made the middle crossbar in the center of the frames to pass through from end to end.

title: Exodus 36:34
content: 34 And he covered the frames with gold. And he made their rings of gold, the holders for the crossbars. And he covered the bars with gold.

title: Exodus 36:35
content: 35 And he made a curtain of blue and purple and worm of scarlet and of twisted fine linen. He made cherubim, the work of a skillful workman.

title: Exodus 36:36
content: 36 And he made for it four pillars of acacia wood, and he covered them {with} gold and their hooks with gold. And he cast for them four bases of silver.

title: Exodus 36:37
content: 37 And he made a curtain for the entrance of the tent: of blue and purple and worm of scarlet and of twisted fine linen, the work of an embroiderer,

title: Exodus 36:38
content: 38 and its five pillars and their hooks. And he covered their tops and their rings {with} gold. And their five bases {were} bronze.

title: Exodus 37:1
content: 1 And Bezalel made the box of wood of acacias—its length {was} two cubits and a half, and its width {was} one cubit and a half, and its height {was} one cubit and a half.

title: Exodus 37:2
content: 2 And he overlaid it {with} pure gold, inside and outside, and for it he made a border of gold around {it}.

title: Exodus 37:3
content: 3 And he cast four rings of gold for it on its four feet: two rings on its one side and two rings on its second side.

title: Exodus 37:4
content: 4 And he made poles of wood of acacias and overlaid them {with} gold.

title: Exodus 37:5
content: 5 And he put the poles into the rings on the sides of the box, to carry the box.

title: Exodus 37:6
content: 6 And he made an atonement lid of pure gold. Its length {was} two cubits and a half, and its width {was} a cubit and a half.

title: Exodus 37:7
content: 7 And he made two gold cherubim; he made them of hammered work from the two ends of the atonement lid.

title: Exodus 37:8
content: 8 One cherub {was} from this end and one cherub from this end. He made the cherubim from the atonement lid from its two ends.

title: Exodus 37:9
content: 9 And the cherubim were spreading out their wings upward, covering over the atonement lid with their wings, and their faces {were} each toward his brother. The faces of the cherubim were toward the atonement lid.

title: Exodus 37:10
content: 10 And he made the table from wood of acacias. Its length {was} two cubits, and its width {was} a cubit, and its height {was} a cubit and a half.

title: Exodus 37:11
content: 11 And he overlaid it {with} pure gold and made for it a border of gold around {it}.

title: Exodus 37:12
content: 12 And he made a rim for it, a handbreadth all around, and he made a border of gold around its rim.

title: Exodus 37:13
content: 13 And he cast four rings of gold for it and put the rings on the four corners, where its four legs are.

title: Exodus 37:14
content: 14 The rings were close to the rim to house the poles to carry the table.

title: Exodus 37:15
content: 15 And he made the poles {out of} wood of acacias and covered them {with} gold to carry the table.

title: Exodus 37:16
content: 16 And he made the objects that {would be} on the table—its plates, and its pans, and its bowls, and its pitchers with which it will be poured out—{from} pure gold.

title: Exodus 37:17
content: 17 And he made the lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand—its base and its shaft—were made of hammered work. Its cups, its buds, and its blossoms were from it.

title: Exodus 37:18
content: 18 And six branches were going out from its sides, three branches of the lampstand from the one side and three branches of the lampstand from the second side.

title: Exodus 37:19
content: 19 Three cups, shaped like almond blossoms, {were} on the one branch, a bulb and a blossom, and three cups, shaped like almond blossoms, were on the one branch, a bulb and a blossom; thus for the six branches going out from the lampstand.

title: Exodus 37:20
content: 20 And on the lampstand {there were} four cups shaped like almond blossoms {with} its bulbs and its blossoms,

title: Exodus 37:21
content: 21 And a bulb {was} under two of the branches from it, and a bulb {was} under two of the branches from it, and a bulb {was} under two of the branches from it—for all six branches extending out from it.

title: Exodus 37:22
content: 22 Their bulbs and their branches from it were all one piece of hammered work of pure gold.

title: Exodus 37:23
content: 23 And he made its seven lamps and its tongs and its trays of pure gold.

title: Exodus 37:24
content: 24 He made it and all its items from a talent of pure gold.

title: Exodus 37:25
content: 25 And he made the altar of incense of wood of acacias. Its length {was} one cubit, and its width one cubit. It {was} square, and its height {was} two cubits. Its horns were part of it.

title: Exodus 37:26
content: 26 And he overlaid it {with} pure gold—its top and all around its sides and its horns—and he made for it a border of gold around {it}.

title: Exodus 37:27
content: 27 And he made two rings of gold for it under its border on its two sides, on its two sides; for housings for the poles for carrying it with them.

title: Exodus 37:28
content: 28 And he made the poles of wood of acacias, and he overlaid them {with} gold.

title: Exodus 37:29
content: 29 And he made the oil of anointment of holiness and the pure incense of fragrance, the work of an ointment maker.

title: Exodus 38:1
content: 1 And he made the altar of the burnt offering of wood of acacias. Its length {was} five cubits and its breadth {was} five cubits—a square—and its height {was} three cubits.

title: Exodus 38:2
content: 2 And he made its horns on its four corners; its horns were part of it. And he overlaid it {with} bronze.

title: Exodus 38:3
content: 3 And he made all of the equipment of the altar: the pots and the shovels and the basins, the meat forks and the firepans. He made all of its equipment {of} bronze.

title: Exodus 38:4
content: 4 And he made a grate for the altar, a work of a network of bronze under its ledge, from below to its middle.

title: Exodus 38:5
content: 5 And he cast four rings on the four ends for the grate of bronze, as holders for the poles.

title: Exodus 38:6
content: 6 And he made the poles of wood of acacias, and overlaid them {with} bronze.

title: Exodus 38:7
content: 7 And he put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, to carry it with them. He made it hollow, of planks.

title: Exodus 38:8
content: 8 And he made a basin of bronze and its base of bronze with the mirrors of the serving {women} who served at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

title: Exodus 38:9
content: 9 And he made the courtyard. For the south side, the curtains of the courtyard {were} 100 cubits of fine twisted linen,

title: Exodus 38:10
content: 10 {with} their 20 pillars and their 20 bronze bases, the hooks of the pillars and their rings of silver.

title: Exodus 38:11
content: 11 And for the north side, 100 cubits {with} their 20 pillars and their 20 bases of bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their rings {were} of silver.

title: Exodus 38:12
content: 12 And the curtains for the side of the west {were} 50 cubits, with their ten pillars and their ten bases. The hooks of the pillars and rings {were} of silver.

title: Exodus 38:13
content: 13 And for the east side 50 cubits.

title: Exodus 38:14
content: 14 The curtains to the side {were} fifteen cubits {with} their three pillars and their three bases.

title: Exodus 38:15
content: 15 And for the second side from this, and from this to the gate of the courtyard, the curtains {were} fifteen cubits {with} their three pillars and their three bases.

title: Exodus 38:16
content: 16 All of the curtains of the courtyard all around {were} fine twisted linen.

title: Exodus 38:17
content: 17 And the bases for the pillars {were} bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their rings {were} silver, and the plating of their tops {was} silver. And all of the pillars of the courtyard {were} filleted {with} silver.

title: Exodus 38:18
content: 18 And the curtain of the gate of the courtyard {was the} work of an embroiderer, blue and purple and worm of scarlet and twisted fine linen. And the length {was} twenty cubits and the height in width {was} five cubits, just as the curtains of the courtyard,

title: Exodus 38:19
content: 19 with their four pillars and their four bases {which were} bronze, and their hooks {which were} silver, and the plating of their tops and its rings {which were} silver.

title: Exodus 38:20
content: 20 And all the tent pegs for the Dwelling and for the courtyard all around {were} bronze.

title: Exodus 38:21
content: 21 These {are} the records of the Dwelling, the Dwelling of the Testimony which was recorded according to the mouth of Moses, the work of the Levites by the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Exodus 38:22
content: 22 And Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah, made everything that Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 38:23
content: 23 And Oholiab son of Ahisamak, from the tribe of Dan, an engraver and a designer and an embroiderer in blue and in purple and in scarlet and in fine linen, {was} with him.

title: Exodus 38:24
content: 24 All the gold used for the work, in all the work of the sanctuary—it was the gold from the raised offering—{was} 29 talents and 730 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary.

title: Exodus 38:25
content: 25 And the silver of the counted of the congregation {was} 100 talents and 1, 775 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary,

title: Exodus 38:26
content: 26 a beka for a head (half a shekel), by the shekel of the sanctuary, from every passer over to the counted ones from a son of 20 years and older—from 603, 550.

title: Exodus 38:27
content: 27 And 100 talents of silver were cast for the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the curtain—100 bases for the 100 talents, a talent for a base.

title: Exodus 38:28
content: 28 And he made hooks for the pillars with the 1, 775. And he overlaid their tops and filleted them.

title: Exodus 38:29
content: 29 And the bronze of the raised offering {was} 70 talents and 2, 400 shekels.

title: Exodus 38:30
content: 30 And with it he made the bases of the entrance of the tent of meeting and the altar of bronze and its grate of bronze and all the equipment of the altar

title: Exodus 38:31
content: 31 and the bases of the surrounding courtyard and the bases of the entrance of the courtyard and all of the tent pegs of the Dwelling and all of the tent pegs of the surrounding courtyard.

title: Exodus 39:1
content: 1 And from the blue and the purple and the worm of scarlet they made finely-woven clothes for service in the Holy Place. And they made the clothes of holiness which {were} for Aaron, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 39:2
content: 2 And he made the ephod from gold, blue, and purple, worm of scarlet, and twisted fine linen.

title: Exodus 39:3
content: 3 And they hammered the thin plates of gold, and he cut {them} into threads to work among the blue and among the purple and among the worm of scarlet and among the fine linen, the work of a skillful craftsman.

title: Exodus 39:4
content: 4 They made joined shoulder pieces for it. It was joined on its two corners.

title: Exodus 39:5
content: 5 And the skillfully crafted sash of the ephod which is on it was from it, of like workmanship, of gold, blue, and purple and worm of scarlet and twined fine linen, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 39:6
content: 6 And they made the stones of onyx {with} ornamental settings of gold surrounding {them}. The names of the sons of Israel {were} engraved on {them like} the engravings of a signet.

title: Exodus 39:7
content: 7 And he put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as stones of reminder for the sons of Israel, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 39:8
content: 8 And he made the breastpiece, the work of a skillful craftsman, like the work of the ephod, from gold, blue, and purple and worm of scarlet and twisted fine linen.

title: Exodus 39:9
content: 9 It was square, folded double. They made the breastpiece, its length: a span; and its width: a span folded double.

title: Exodus 39:10
content: 10 And they set in it four rows of precious stones. The first row {was} a row of a ruby, of a topaz, and of a garnet.

title: Exodus 39:11
content: 11 And the second row: an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.

title: Exodus 39:12
content: 12 And the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst.

title: Exodus 39:13
content: 13 And the fourth row: a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. {The stones were} surrounded by ornamental gold settings.

title: Exodus 39:14
content: 14 And the precious stones {were} according to the names of the sons of Israel—they {were} according to their 12 names. Each {was like} the engraving of a signet according to its name—for the 12 tribes.

title: Exodus 39:15
content: 15 And they made twisted chains on the breastpiece, as a work of rope—pure gold.

title: Exodus 39:16
content: 16 And they made two ornamental settings of gold and two rings of gold and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastpiece.

title: Exodus 39:17
content: 17 And they attached the two chains of gold to the rings on the two ends of the breastpiece.

title: Exodus 39:18
content: 18 And they attached two of the ends of the two chains to the two ornamental settings. And they attached those to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front of its face.

title: Exodus 39:19
content: 19 And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastpiece, on the edge which is toward the inner side of the ephod.

title: Exodus 39:20
content: 20 And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder pieces of the ephod on the bottom of the front of its face, close to its joining above the skillfully crafted waistband of the ephod.

title: Exodus 39:21
content: 21 And they tied the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a cord of blue to be on the finely crafted waistband of the ephod, so the breastpiece could not become detached from {being} with the ephod just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 39:22
content: 22 And he made the robe of the ephod entirely of blue, the work of a weaver.

title: Exodus 39:23
content: 23 The opening of the robe {was} in the middle of it like an opening of a garment. The edge for its opening was all around so that it could not tear.

title: Exodus 39:24
content: 24 On the bottom hem of the robe they made pomegranates of twisted blue, purple, and scarlet yarn.

title: Exodus 39:25
content: 25 And they made bells of pure gold, and they put the bells between the pomegranates all around on the bottom edge of the robe, between the pomegranates—

title: Exodus 39:26
content: 26 a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate—all around on the hem of the robe for serving, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 39:27
content: 27 And they made the tunics of fine linen for Aaron and for his sons, the work of a weaver,

title: Exodus 39:28
content: 28 and the fine linen turban and the fine linen ornate headbands and the linen undergarments of fine twisted linen

title: Exodus 39:29
content: 29 and the sash of fine linen and of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, the work of an embroiderer, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 39:30
content: 30 And they made the rosette of the crown of holiness of pure gold and inscribed an inscription on it, like the engraving on a signet, “Holy to Yahweh.”

title: Exodus 39:31
content: 31 And they put a cord of blue on it to attach it on the top of the turban, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 39:32
content: 32 And all the service of the Dwelling, the tent of meeting, was finished. And the sons of Israel did according to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses; thus they did.

title: Exodus 39:33
content: 33 And they brought the Dwelling to Moses: the tent and all its equipment and its clasps and its frames and its bars and its pillars and its bases;

title: Exodus 39:34
content: 34 and the covering of reddened hides of rams and the covering of hides of sea-cows and the curtain of covering;

title: Exodus 39:35
content: 35 the Box of the Testimony and the poles and the atonement lid;

title: Exodus 39:36
content: 36 the table with all of its equipment and the bread of the faces;

title: Exodus 39:37
content: 37 the pure lampstand with its lamps, lamps of the row, and all its accessories and the oil of the light;

title: Exodus 39:38
content: 38 and the altar of gold and the oil of anointing and the incense of fragrance and the curtain of the entrance of the tent;

title: Exodus 39:39
content: 39 the altar of bronze and the grate of bronze that {is} for it, its poles and all of its utensils, the basin and its base;

title: Exodus 39:40
content: 40 the curtains of the courtyard, its pillars and bases and the curtain of the gate of the courtyard, its ropes and its tent pegs and all the items of the service of the Dwelling for the tent of meeting;

title: Exodus 39:41
content: 41 finely-woven clothing for serving in the Holy Place, the clothing of holiness for Aaron the priest, and the clothing of his sons, to {be} priests.

title: Exodus 39:42
content: 42 Thus the sons of Israel did all the work according to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 39:43
content: 43 And Moses saw all of the work, and behold, they had done it. Just as Yahweh had commanded, thus they had done. And Moses blessed them.

title: Exodus 40:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Exodus 40:2
content: 2 “On the first day of the month, in the first month, you shall raise up the Dwelling of the tent of meeting.

title: Exodus 40:3
content: 3 And you shall place the Box of the Testimony there, and you shall cover over the box with the curtain.

title: Exodus 40:4
content: 4 And you shall bring in the table and arrange its arrangement. And you shall bring in the lampstand and set up its lamps.

title: Exodus 40:5
content: 5 And you shall put the altar of gold for incense before the face of the Box of the Testimony, and you shall place the curtain of the gate to the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 40:6
content: 6 And you shall put the altar of the burnt offering before the face of the gate of the Dwelling, the tent of meeting.

title: Exodus 40:7
content: 7 And you shall put the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water there.

title: Exodus 40:8
content: 8 And you shall set up the courtyard around it, and set up the curtain of the gate of the courtyard.

title: Exodus 40:9
content: 9 And you shall take the oil of anointing and anoint the Dwelling and everything that is in it. And you shall set apart it and all its furnishings, and it will be holy.

title: Exodus 40:10
content: 10 And you shall anoint the altar of the burnt offering and all its utensils. And you shall set apart the altar, and the altar will be a holiest holy thing.

title: Exodus 40:11
content: 11 And you shall anoint the basin and its base and set it apart.

title: Exodus 40:12
content: 12 And you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the gate of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.

title: Exodus 40:13
content: 13 And you shall clothe Aaron with the garments of holiness and anoint him and set him apart, and he will serve as a priest to me.

title: Exodus 40:14
content: 14 And you shall bring his sons and clothe them {with} tunics.

title: Exodus 40:15
content: 15 And you shall anoint them just as you anointed their father, and they will serve as priests to me. And their anointing will cause them to be a priesthood forever throughout their generations.”

title: Exodus 40:16
content: 16 And Moses did according to all that Yahweh had commanded him. Thus he did.

title: Exodus 40:17
content: 17 And it was in the first month, the second year, on the first of the month {that} the Dwelling was raised up.

title: Exodus 40:18
content: 18 And Moses raised up the Dwelling and placed its bases and set up its frames and placed its bars and set up its pillars.

title: Exodus 40:19
content: 19 And he spread the tent over the Dwelling and put the covering of the tent over it on the top, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 40:20
content: 20 And he took the testimony and put {it} into the box. And he put the poles on the box and put the atonement lid on the top of the box.

title: Exodus 40:21
content: 21 And he brought the box into the Dwelling. And he set up the curtain of covering, and he covered over the Box of the Testimony, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 40:22
content: 22 And he put the table into the tent of meeting, on the north side of the Dwelling, outside of the curtain.

title: Exodus 40:23
content: 23 And he arranged on it the arrangement of bread before the face of Yahweh, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 40:24
content: 24 And he put the lampstand into the tent of meeting, across from the table, on the south side of the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 40:25
content: 25 And he lifted up the lamps before the face of Yahweh, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 40:26
content: 26 And he put the altar of gold into the tent of meeting in front of the face of the curtain.

title: Exodus 40:27
content: 27 And he caused smoke on it, incense of fragrance, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 40:28
content: 28 And he set up the curtain of the gate of the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 40:29
content: 29 And he put the altar of the burnt offering at the gate of the Dwelling, the tent of meeting, and offered up on it the burnt offering and the grain offering, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 40:30
content: 30 And he placed the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and he put water for washing there.

title: Exodus 40:31
content: 31 And Moses, and Aaron, and his sons would wash their hands and their feet from it.

title: Exodus 40:32
content: 32 Whenever they went into the tent of meeting and whenever they went close to the altar, they washed themselves, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Exodus 40:33
content: 33 And he raised up the courtyard around the Dwelling and the altar. And he set up the curtain of the gate of the courtyard. And Moses finished the work.

title: Exodus 40:34
content: 34 And the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of Yahweh filled the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 40:35
content: 35 And Moses was not able to go into the tent of meeting, because the cloud had settled on it and the glory of Yahweh had filled the Dwelling.

title: Exodus 40:36
content: 36 And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the Dwelling, the sons of Israel would set out on all their travels,

title: Exodus 40:37
content: 37 but if the cloud was not taken up, then they would not set out until the day it was taken up.

title: Exodus 40:38
content: 38 For the cloud of Yahweh {was} over the Dwelling by day, and fire was on it by night, before the eyes of all the house of Israel in all their travels.
